revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-05 18:46:48.000000000', 'message': 'De-dupe subnet IDs when calling neutron /subnets API

In the _get_subnets_from_port method, we call the neutron /subnets API
to list subnets filtered by subnet IDs. We get the subnet IDs by
iterating all of the fixed IPs for the instance and sending the list of
corresponding subnet IDs. The python-neutronclient sends the list of
subnet IDs as a query string in the URI. When an instance has a large
number of interfaces attached, the list of subnet IDs can be too long
for the URI, resulting in a RequestURITooLong error from neutronclient.

This de-dupes the subnet IDs before calling neutron, to handle the case
where an instance has a large number of interfaces attached, but many
of them are on the same subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1796074

Change-Id: I5b52ff81f74ae7cb11e6f012ab7e53cfc6821486
(cherry picked from commit ab5fc6870260d3b3c3bce90a7123c17816bf0093)
'}]
commit_message:
De-dupe subnet IDs when calling neutron /subnets API

In the _get_subnets_from_port method, we call the neutron /subnets API
to list subnets filtered by subnet IDs. We get the subnet IDs by
iterating all of the fixed IPs for the instance and sending the list of
corresponding subnet IDs. The python-neutronclient sends the list of
subnet IDs as a query string in the URI. When an instance has a large
number of interfaces attached, the list of subnet IDs can be too long
for the URI, resulting in a RequestURITooLong error from neutronclient.

This de-dupes the subnet IDs before calling neutron, to handle the case
where an instance has a large number of interfaces attached, but many
of them are on the same subnet.

Closes-Bug: #1796074

Change-Id: I5b52ff81f74ae7cb11e6f012ab7e53cfc6821486
(cherry picked from commit ab5fc6870260d3b3c3bce90a7123c17816bf0093)

messages: [{'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-10-09 03:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-10-22 01:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-11-05 02:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-11-08 08:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-11-08 12:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:09:12.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Idd0dd8b137f6cbf22cbb706645488271b0e5cee5
"}, {'created': '2018-10-22 01:07:57.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Idd0dd8b137f6cbf22cbb706645488271b0e5cee5
"}, {'created': '2018-11-05 02:15:41.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Idd0dd8b137f6cbf22cbb706645488271b0e5cee5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Idd0dd8b137f6cbf22cbb706645488271b0e5cee5

commit_message:
Add dragonflow-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for dragonflow-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I9791b3fcce65b08f92b3c5d54b529633579f795a
Story: 2003657
Task: 26128

are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: If1d2db738ad8e3f3416557fe1d0b00d65c6802ea

commit_message:
add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: Ie2250722473b150e0c56dce0da220c615df51c34

commit_message:
Correct errors handling bridge event in provider app

Passed a wrong key to self.bridge_macs and a wrong arg to
self._egress_placeholder_flow.
The new test case can catch them.

Change-Id: I639998c14ff6ef5ad766874dfa4cd5e178fbf7c5

messages:
[{'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2018-09-11 07:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-09-12 10:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9044, 'date': '2018-09-16 02:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-11-08 08:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Though I agree that that printing the class name does not help at all, I would prefer to have a print of the port ID or something similar in the info logs, while adding the complete port print to debug logs, where they belong.
An object may be quite big, thus making the logs less readable.
@oanson - I would appreciate your opinion.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-11-08 11:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 07:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Print details of Switchport in log

__repr__ has been customized in base class, so using it can help to
print details of Switchport in log. Or else, only class name will be
printed, which is barely helpful.

Change-Id: I98bf878af6238d96cb2e48c29cd305883d4e7530
'}]
commit_message:
Print details of Switchport in log

__repr__ has been customized in base class, so using it can help to
print details of Switchport in log. Or else, only class name will be
printed, which is barely helpful.

Change-Id: I98bf878af6238d96cb2e48c29cd305883d4e7530

commit_message:
security group denies TCP flows when chassis-snat is enabled

The ingress packet should pass through security group flows to let
CT to update the state of the flow. Otherwise, the subsequent flows
would be blocked by the security group because of a invalid state of
the flow

Change-Id: I94cb3ec06d1b1335586c353a35020c9655d520af
Closes-Bug: 1792307

subject: Add note about LLDP workaround for switches on Dell OS 9.11
messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-11-08 11:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-08 11:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-08 11:03:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add note about LLDP workaround for switches on Dell OS 9.11

The Dell LLDP workaround is not necessary on switches running newer
versions of Dell Networking OS. Since version 9.11(2.0P1), the interface
description can be advertised by LLDP, at least for S6000 and S3048‚ÄìON
switches.

Change-Id: Iaccab56ba068d1ca9ab9c0351d5ffc32a2348787
'}]
commit_message:
Add note about LLDP workaround for switches on Dell OS 9.11

The Dell LLDP workaround is not necessary on switches running newer
versions of Dell Networking OS. Since version 9.11(2.0P1), the interface
description can be advertised by LLDP, at least for S6000 and S3048‚ÄìON
switches.

Change-Id: Iaccab56ba068d1ca9ab9c0351d5ffc32a2348787

TrivialFix

'}, {'created': '2018-11-08 13:31:21.000000000', 'message': 'Open vSwitch service name is different between distros

commit_message:
Open vSwitch service name is different between distros

The service is called openvswitch-switch on Debian/Ubuntu derivatives -
this starts ovsdb-server.service and ovs-vswitchd.service as
dependencies.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0cb06a387cfeadadb3b978afb4d17a88e9935d17

commit_message:
Add OSPROFILER_CONNECTION_STRING option to Devstack plugin

It is optional configuration option. If this is set together with
OSPROFILER_HMAC_KEYS rally html report will use osprofiler api to
generate html report for each trace and embed it as iframe to our
native html repor.

Change-Id: I74323f1cd079850290afa62ad18e27643ec03873

the v2.7.1 release of ansible, see:

commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I45a33952bb3b00df4beeb912626fe659ee9c0d06

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 17:08:37.000000000', 'message': "Update ansible to 2.4.6

It also seems that Ansible became more strict about the permissions of
the current working directory[1] so we need to either move our ansible.cfg
to a better location, or get rid of it. In the zuul test environment, the
location is world-writable.

Given that this is an ansible.cfg used for tests only, that its content is
(mostly) duplicated in the wrapper's RC file and that implementation of
avoiding the wrapper was done when we had vars plugins (which we no longer
have), I think it's safe to remove it and use the wrapper instead.

Using the wrapper ensures that everything is set in one place, so it's
easier to find. In the AIO bootstrap we then just make sure we override
things that we do not want to interfere with the AIO bootstrap - then unset
them later so that the defaults get applied from then on.

To also reduce the duplication of the bootstrap-aio.sh script in the
gate-check-commit script, we source bootstrap-aio from gate-check-commit.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/ff980afefdbe4ceb828bdb1bb2eef03cf616bf63

Change-Id: I6a673c3c4f228d11a9d93766021409a5b1672f63
(cherry picked from commit 24bd4a781fe1ccce532ba032dd28631a954111d7)
"}]
commit_message:
Update ansible to 2.4.6

It also seems that Ansible became more strict about the permissions of
the current working directory[1] so we need to either move our ansible.cfg
to a better location, or get rid of it. In the zuul test environment, the
location is world-writable.

Given that this is an ansible.cfg used for tests only, that its content is
(mostly) duplicated in the wrapper's RC file and that implementation of
avoiding the wrapper was done when we had vars plugins (which we no longer
have), I think it's safe to remove it and use the wrapper instead.

Using the wrapper ensures that everything is set in one place, so it's
easier to find. In the AIO bootstrap we then just make sure we override
things that we do not want to interfere with the AIO bootstrap - then unset
them later so that the defaults get applied from then on.

To also reduce the duplication of the bootstrap-aio.sh script in the
gate-check-commit script, we source bootstrap-aio from gate-check-commit.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/ff980afefdbe4ceb828bdb1bb2eef03cf616bf63

Change-Id: I6a673c3c4f228d11a9d93766021409a5b1672f63
(cherry picked from commit 24bd4a781fe1ccce532ba032dd28631a954111d7)

commit_message:
Fix auth_uri deprecation

[1] deprecated the auth_uri parameter for magnum::keystone::authtoken,
however it silently ignored the deprecated value and never used
variable $www_authenticate_uri_real. This commit fixes that.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/558435

Change-Id: Icdaa70469c7e6d2c9d0624305cb54ed55c54be5d
(cherry picked from commit c115c31c75aa8291ec577af544807f24f7f4a8b8)

commit_message:
Set pipefail during overcloud upgrade tasks.

Without pipefail set, errors are masked by awk. So conditional
blocks are always skipped.

Change-Id: I7dde76c3c2d2741c775c348b71f4ae264cfcfcca
(cherry picked from commit 744200947cf92a49b15b7a6479c44a56941dacdd)

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Ie378b24c559c04f235890f7eaa2ba82161b0604d
Closes-Bug:  #1801660

The new functional tests started failing up in the chain after the rebase. It seems that before placement microversion 1.29 (nested support in allocation_candidates) the nested bandwidth RPs worked _by chance_. After 1.29 is merged in placement the nested RPs doesn't work without asking version=1.29 from placement. So this chain of commits now depends on supporting 1.29 in scheduler report client."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-06 16:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/568840/18/ : SUCCESS in 3h 24m 35s'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-13 14:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-13 14:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Workflow-1

The new functional tests started failing up in the chain after the rebase. It seems that before placement microversion 1.29 (nested support in allocation_candidates) the nested bandwidth RPs worked _by chance_. After 1.29 is merged in placement the nested RPs doesn't work without asking version=1.29 from placement. So this chain of commits now depends on supporting 1.29 in scheduler report client."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-13 15:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20: Patch Set 19 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-08-13 15:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 13:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make placement.lib.RequestGroup a versioned object

Later patches will introduce a field in RequestSpec using this type as
the field type.

This patch does not intend to change the externally visible structure
or behavior of the RequestGroup object however the member_of field
of the original object is used with many different types:
* list of list of strings
* list of tuple of strings
* list of set of strings

The proposed versioned object accepts iterable of iterable of string
types but normalize them to list of list of strings for storage.

Change-Id: I46c97d2641d9685ef59771314665a17a5236097d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

'}, {'created': '2018-05-16 15:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add request_spec.RequestGroup versioned object

Later patches will introduce a field in RequestSpec using this type as
the field type.

This patch refactors the usage of placement.lib.RequestGroup. Until now
this class was used both by placement and nova services and they used
it only as a util class. However after this series the nova services
would like to use such a class via RPC which requires an OVO. This
patch makes sure that the new OVO is used by nova and the old plain
object is used by placement. This way placement is not forced to use
an OVO where no OVO functionality is required.

Change-Id: I46c97d2641d9685ef59771314665a17a5236097d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
Add request_spec.RequestGroup versioned object

Later patches will introduce a field in RequestSpec using this type as
the field type to store the resource requests coming from outside of
Nova like the bandwidth request coming from the Neutron ports.

This patch refactors the usage of placement.lib.RequestGroup. Until now
this class was used both by placement and nova services and they used
it only as a util class. However after this series the nova services
would like to use such a class via RPC which requires an OVO. This
patch makes sure that the new OVO is used by nova and the old plain
object is used by placement. This way placement is not forced to use
an OVO where no OVO functionality is required.

The minimum required version of oslo.versionedobjects is updated to
1.33.3 to include the fix for bug 1771804.

Change-Id: I46c97d2641d9685ef59771314665a17a5236097d
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

commit_message:
(Partial) Revert "Use container_cli for post_upgrade_tasks & external_upgrade_tasks"

This reverts commit de798c5947a910446103908366837da5705033cd.

This is a partial revert of (docker|puppet)/services where we run Docker
CLI during the upgrade_tasks.

Indeed, we still want to hardcode Docker for now because the
upgrade_tasks happens before the transition from Docker to Podman.
Until it changes, we need to runs these commands before the deployment
on Podman.

Note: common/deploy-steps.j2 is excluded from the revert.

Closes-Bug: #1801940
Change-Id: Id1275cf3eee9e23419c2908801f26a40d32fb7b2

commit_message:
Fix Swift storage device setup

The formerly extra puppet parameter "base_dir" has been ignored when
switching to a containerized overcloud, which broke support for
non-default device path - for example when using multipath devices.

Closes-Bug: 1777116
Change-Id: If60479998a9f02393c0d49d1b752b9ef4f8f9aff
(cherry picked from commit e0ec6f5b75f0662b7c0241a9a12dc3743ceec8cf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 15:52:24.000000000', 'message': "add resource_requests field to RequestSpec

The new RequestSpec.resource_requests stores a list of RequestGroup
objects each representing a granual resource request group requesting
resource for the given instance.

This will be used in a later patch to communicate the Neutron port's
resource requests. Also this can be used later to refactor flavor
and image metadata based resource request.

This new field is intentionally not persisted to the DB for two
reasons:
* the port's resource request is already persisted in neutron
  so this would be a data duplication
* this field only used to carry information from the the nova-conductor
  to the nova-scheduler for each select_destinations() request

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider
Change-Id: I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8
"}, {'created': '2018-05-16 13:06:05.000000000', 'message': "Add requested_resources field to RequestSpec

The new RequestSpec.resource_requests stores a list of RequestGroup
objects each representing a granual resource request group requesting
resource for the given instance.

This will be used in a later patch to communicate the Neutron port's
resource requests to the scheduler. Also this can be used later to
refactor flavor and image metadata based resource request handling.

This new field is intentionally not persisted to the DB for two
reasons:
* the port's resource request is already persisted in neutron
  so this would be a data duplication that could lead to data
  inconsistencies
* this field only used to carry information from the the nova-conductor
  to the nova-scheduler for each select_destinations() request

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider
Change-Id: I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8

The new RequestSpec.resource_requests stores a list of RequestGroup
objects each representing a granular resource request group requesting
resource for the given instance.

This will be used in a later patch to communicate the Neutron port's
resource request to the scheduler. Also this can be used later to
refactor flavor and image metadata based resource request handling.

This new field is intentionally not persisted to the DB for two
reasons:
* the port's resource request is already persisted in neutron
  so this would be a data duplication that could lead to data
  inconsistencies
* this field is only used to carry information from the the
  nova-conductor to the nova-scheduler for each select_destinations()
  request

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider
Change-Id: I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8

commit_message:
Add requested_resources field to RequestSpec

The new RequestSpec.resource_requests stores a list of RequestGroup
objects each representing a granular resource request group requesting
resource for the given instance.

This will be used in a later patch to communicate the Neutron port's
resource request to the scheduler. Also this can be used later to
refactor flavor-based resource request handling.

This new field is intentionally not persisted to the DB for two
reasons:

* the port's resource request is already persisted in neutron
  so this would be a data duplication that could lead to data
  inconsistencies
* this field is only used to carry information from the the
  nova-conductor to the nova-scheduler for each select_destinations()
  request

blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider
Change-Id: I53e5debcffd6de2b3a2ff838e7f5da33fa1a82b8

commit_message:
Add bandwidth related standard resource classes

Introduce NET_BW_EGR_KILOBIT_PER_SEC and
NET_BW_IGR_KILOBIT_PER_SEC resource classes.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I996bf705b14b564106426a2e57299638fb178750

commit_message:
Adds libmagic on plaforms missing it

Installs libmagic on platforms where is not installed by defaut,
to allow development work on them.

Change-Id: Ia9f7319c375c2dce7dd86c271c731b44a70ec036

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-08 10:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auth_uri deprecation

[1] deprecated the auth_uri parameter for magnum::keystone::authtoken,
however it silently ignored the deprecated value and never used
variable $www_authenticate_uri_real. This commit fixes that.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/558435

Change-Id: Icdaa70469c7e6d2c9d0624305cb54ed55c54be5d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth_uri deprecation

[1] deprecated the auth_uri parameter for magnum::keystone::authtoken,
however it silently ignored the deprecated value and never used
variable $www_authenticate_uri_real. This commit fixes that.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/558435

Change-Id: Icdaa70469c7e6d2c9d0624305cb54ed55c54be5d

This commit adds constraints preventing 2 kuryr-controllers from being
created in non-HA deployments running on K8s when doing an update of the K8s

Closes-Bug: 1802099

commit_message:
Make sure we never have 2 kuryr-controllers

This commit adds constraints preventing 2 kuryr-controllers from being
created in non-HA deployments running on K8s when doing an update of the K8s
Deployment (e.g. when upgrading the kuryr-controller image).

Change-Id: Ic5fe9aa9e63f2bee51d85e112d543e6955ab3bc8
Closes-Bug: 1802099

Brent provided a reason in his earlier comment.

Also consider that nova.servers_list is a global action. The way we use this workflow from the Heat is actually a violation of the isolation of the overcloud stack provided by Heat. We shouldn't be touching servers that are outside of the overcloud stack when we do a stack-update on the overcloud.

That issues is not strictly related to what's being fixed here. It does however support the case where you may have non-ACTIVE servers."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:24:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Handle failed nodes when enabling ssh admin

Filter server list by state before selecting by control plane address to
avoid YAQL expression issues.

Change-Id: I0ae383105bc5d8849a733bfbe5bd61fb3fc24c66

commit_message:
Capture json console and write it to workspace for reproducer

As part of the task at [1] we need to capture some variables
from the ci run (like executed pre-run playbooks). This writes
the json console to a file in the logs/workspace directory so
we can use in the reproducer with [2].

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/270
[2] Used by https://review.openstack.org/613572
Co-Authored-By: Gabriele Cerami <gcerami@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I75030a5cd75fbd324356fdff9d0a07e51a3a2c7f

Change-Id: I39b0cc0bdfee7a1a13f8e0e9625e210ff83f6d9a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow virtual tunnel ports to also have virtual sources

In some cases, tunneling applications will also want to specify
the source IP of the tunnel. This is in case the tunneling
network is different than the main network, as specified by
local_ip.

Change-Id: I39b0cc0bdfee7a1a13f8e0e9625e210ff83f6d9a

subject: Python3 complains when iterate bytes string
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-12 10:20:50.000000000', 'message': 'Python3 complains when iterate bytes string

Using Python3 to iterate a bytes string, int will be presented.
However, in Python2, str will be presented.

Closes-Bug: #1792120
Change-Id: Id30f5f1da989fdb71e0f9b627e875e0c41f89b30
'}]
commit_message:
Python3 complains when iterate bytes string

Using Python3 to iterate a bytes string, int will be presented.
However, in Python2, str will be presented.

Closes-Bug: #1792120
Change-Id: Id30f5f1da989fdb71e0f9b627e875e0c41f89b30

[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-11-05 13:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-11-05 20:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So after talking about this change today, I feel it is Ok for the stable branches for two reasons:

1) It fixes the bug where the network dns_domain is ignored, which is blocking some users
2) If a tenant is "surprised" when an update happens and the dns_domain value in their network starts being used unexpectedly, they can clear it and get the previous behavior of using the one from the conf file set by the administrator.

We are going to ask Miguel for his opinion so the final decision does not seem biased.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-11-07 19:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-11-07 20:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-11-05 13:13:51.000000000', 'message': "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf

The Neutron API exposes the 'dns_domain' attribute on the
Network model. Presently, deployments using the DHCP
agent ignore this attribute when resolving DNS queries
between instances. This patch changes that so that
the DHCP agent will pass on the dns_domain to the
network's dnsmasq process, in turn passing it to
instances.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: 1774710
Change-Id: I6120d504959631f084d63458f6e9dada0dc5cbdf
(cherry picked from commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6)
"}]
commit_message:
Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf

The Neutron API exposes the 'dns_domain' attribute on the
Network model. Presently, deployments using the DHCP
agent ignore this attribute when resolving DNS queries
between instances. This patch changes that so that
the DHCP agent will pass on the dns_domain to the
network's dnsmasq process, in turn passing it to
instances.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: 1774710
Change-Id: I6120d504959631f084d63458f6e9dada0dc5cbdf
(cherry picked from commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-11 22:55:18.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
3. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and
   as the 'func_' prefix is pointless.
4. We remove the base python setting in the lxc tox target
   because we're not running our functional tests using py3
   yet.

Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149
(cherry picked from commit f6ab8c4a8af15caba9d73fbcce95d18a76514cfc)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
3. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and
   as the 'func_' prefix is pointless.
4. We remove the base python setting in the lxc tox target
   because we're not running our functional tests using py3
   yet.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/603941
Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149
(cherry picked from commit f6ab8c4a8af15caba9d73fbcce95d18a76514cfc)

commit_message:
IPv6 support for Veritas Access Manila driver

Adding IPv6 support and some modifications in Veritas Access
API call for allow_access and deny_access.

Change-Id: I288a63d9c1e4a217aaf06c9a1ace3c0a49231dd6
Implement: blueprint veritas-access-manila-ipv6-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 14:59:36.000000000', 'message': 'ovs/sriov mech drivers: resource_provider_uuid5_namespace

Set a UUID v5 namespace for the Open vSwitch mechanism driver and
another for the SR-IOV mechanism driver. These will be used to
deterministically generate Placement Resource Provider UUIDs.

Change-Id: I365a0aeefffe68bd7d5ba5f6697b814bf2713a19
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
ovs/sriov mech drivers: resource_provider_uuid5_namespace

Set a UUID v5 namespace for the Open vSwitch mechanism driver and
another for the SR-IOV mechanism driver. These will be used to
deterministically generate Placement Resource Provider UUIDs.

Change-Id: I365a0aeefffe68bd7d5ba5f6697b814bf2713a19
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586567
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

[{'created': '2017-03-29 22:06:23.000000000', 'message': 'blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

Spec: triple-routed-networks-templates Refactor THT for routed nets.

This spec describes the problem set and work items to implement support
for routed network deployment with TripleO Heat templates. For routed
networks, we will need to support an additional layer of abstraction
for isolated networks, where there are multiple broadcast domains, each
with their own VLANs. Separate VLANs with routers connecting them
allows for horizontal scalability and reduced broadcast, multicast and
unknown unicast traffic within each VLAN.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I50dab467fde8a1e62ab0b24ce12d639d72dd692b
Depends-On: I72861ce8adfeff67b894cf389f7096cde8be9258

'}, {'created': '2018-06-07 11:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

Spec: triple-routed-networks-templates Refactor THT for routed nets.

This spec implements better routing between isolated VLANs when using
routed spine-and-leaf. Separate VLANs with routers connecting them
allows for horizontal scalability and reduced broadcast, multicast and
unknown unicast traffic within each VLAN.

The routes added to the network_data.yaml allow traffic to be routed
on a per-network basis. This allows a supernet to be used for each
network, so traffic to and from that network will use the appropriate
interface or VLAN. A new network_data_routed.yaml demonstrates this.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I50dab467fde8a1e62ab0b24ce12d639d72dd692b
'}, {'created': '2018-10-30 14:37:25.000000000', 'message': 'blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I50dab467fde8a1e62ab0b24ce12d639d72dd692b

commit_message:
blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

Spec: triple-routed-networks-templates Refactor THT for routed nets.

This spec describes the problem set and work items to implement support
for routed network deployment with TripleO Heat templates. For routed
networks, we will need to support an additional layer of abstraction
for isolated networks, where there are multiple broadcast domains, each
with their own VLANs. Separate VLANs with routers connecting them
allows for horizontal scalability and reduced broadcast, multicast and
unknown unicast traffic within each VLAN.

This is a dependency of blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment

Change-Id: I50dab467fde8a1e62ab0b24ce12d639d72dd692b

commit_message:
Abstract over differerences in Open vSwitch package name

This is need for Debian/Ubuntu support. This was missed from the
initial ubuntu support patch as it is only installed if
the ovs-vsctl command is missing.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I36c2e71234dd8b446deb382d705ac74add6a3bdf

Fix execute_script method to avoid infinite wait.

Fix execute_script method
Add support for timeout to execute_script

commit_message:
Add connectivity test via 2 routers and tenant networks

This patch adds test to check if connectivity through 2 routers
and internal network between routers works fine.

When at least two compute nodes are available for tempest and
DifferentHostFilter is enabled in nova-scheduler VM1 and VM2 will be
spawned on two different compute nodes.

Connectivity scenario in test is like on picture below:

	    +-----+
	    | VM 1|
	    +--+--+
	       |
	       | Network 1 (tenant network)
	       |
	     +-+-+
	     | R1|
	     +-+-+
	       |
	       | Network 3 (tenant network)
	       |
	     +-+-+
	     | R2|
	     +-+-+
	       |
	       | Network 2 (tenant network)
	       |
	    +--+--+
	    | VM 2|
	    +-----+

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/597567
Change-Id: Ie9903b7078d6fcff307c5d76770d92df1152d473
Related-Bug: #1786272

[{'created': '2018-11-07 20:41:30.000000000', 'message': 'Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
(cherry picked from commit 916e7745166d404f187533de702726aac3ef6eba)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
(cherry picked from commit 916e7745166d404f187533de702726aac3ef6eba)

commit_message:
Add support for www_authentication_uri

We do currently not support www_authentication_uri at all, which
is the new standard, as auth_uri has long been deprecated.

* Make sure we support both auth_uri and www_authenticate_uri.
* Switched to www_authenticate_uri for devstack.
* Fixed a bug where a bad exception would be thrown if auth_uri
  was not set.
  
Story: 2004271
Task: 27819

Change-Id: Ibc932d35f3d6ba2ac7ffb6193aa37bd4a3d4422e

commit_message:
Hide some alarm properties in the UI.

The following alarm properties should not be visible in the UI: 
vitrage_cached_id, vitrage_resource_type, vitrage_resource_id

commit_message:
Modify dockerhub secrets

Currently publishing jobs in pike and ocata
are failing login to dockerhub.

TASK [Login to Dockerhub]
Output suppressed because no_log was given
PLAY RECAP
ok: 0 changed: 0 unreachable: 0 failed: 1

Only difference i can see is the secrets.
Jobs are failing around when this patch was merged which
changed credentials layout.
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/commit/98276e8ed8d23cc4f79f575d5bda24d443db2278#diff-7415f5ff7beee2cdf9ffe31e12e4c086

Change-Id: I8a5aed414052d098a20a4d92357fa2e6d34335ba

commit_message:
Remove Dragonflow ML2 driver

Dragonflow is no longer maintained as an OpenStack project [1]
and has therefore been removed from OpenStack-Ansible as a
supported ML2 driver for neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/613856
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615576

Change-Id: I3dc43800faf8eac5dcc8767c69f3cdab1eebe021

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 20:41:08.000000000', 'message': 'Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
(cherry picked from commit 916e7745166d404f187533de702726aac3ef6eba)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
(cherry picked from commit 916e7745166d404f187533de702726aac3ef6eba)

commit_message:
Hide some alarm properties in the UI.

The following alarm properties should not be visible in the UI: 
vitrage_cached_id, vitrage_resource_type, vitrage_resource_id

Change-Id: I006e7b6a04056a541a9524a24ae0fe4c3a80a618

commit_message:
Fix accessing to optional cinder pool attributes

Leave storage pool arguments empty if they are not provided
by cinderclient.

Change-Id: I90435146b33465c8eef95a6104e53285f785b014
Closes-Bug: #1800468
(cherry picked from commit e8c08e2abbce8d9791024f46220e37b49381cd48)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 11:02:49.000000000', 'message': 'supported_vnic_type configurable for sriov

Now supported_vnic_types is hardcoded to the mechanism drivers, but that
can depend on several factors, like type of the NIC, admin decision,
etc.
With this patch we put the right to decide which vnic types are
supported for ovs agent into the admin, by allowing blacklisting items
from the mechanism driver specific list.

Change-Id: Iad9e2e966df53b4164d2a56a93215c69825b5241
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/605079
Partial-Bug: #1578989

commit_message:
supported_vnic_type configurable for sriov

Now supported_vnic_types is hardcoded to the mechanism drivers, but that
can depend on several factors, like type of the NIC, admin decision,
etc.
With this patch we put the right to decide which vnic types are
supported for ovs agent into the hands of the admin, by allowing
blacklisting items from the mechanism driver specific list.
Background: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_qos/2018/
neutron_qos.2018-07-31-15.00.log.html#l-58

Change-Id: Iad9e2e966df53b4164d2a56a93215c69825b5241
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-08 00:50:43.000000000', 'message': "Log the compute ID when nova fails

When nova fails to successfuly start an amphora and we hit our
ComputeWaitTimeoutException, currently it's hard to see the compute
ID nova issued us. This patch includes it in the exception message
so we can track the ID back into the nova logs to see why nova
failed.

Change-Id: I3e89ac3aae526b8d705a408e7c0a9eaba6bca193
"}]
commit_message:
Log the compute ID when nova fails

When nova fails to successfuly start an amphora and we hit our
ComputeWaitTimeoutException, currently it's hard to see the compute
ID nova issued us. This patch includes it in the exception message
so we can track the ID back into the nova logs to see why nova
failed.

Change-Id: I3e89ac3aae526b8d705a408e7c0a9eaba6bca193

commit_message:
Collect StatsD metrics from Monasca services

Some Monasca services support sending StatsD metrics to
allow monitoring those services. This commit connects
these services to the StatsD service provided by the
Monasca Agent.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I1da376384a31b89fea1b8a6f907aea35282909a4

commit_message:
Add directories to osd-devices as well

Tracking directory backed OSDs in the kv store allows
us to bootstrap further relations based on bootstrapped
OSD counts.

Change-Id: I1abd767d15c204845d9909d9c7ee9414dbe87a5c
Closes-Bug: #1802134
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/616230/

commit_message:
Disable OVN related services in ODL env file

ODL and OVN services are mutually exclusive and
leads to deployment failure when enabled on a role.
This patch sets OVN services to OS::Heat::None in
ODL env file to disable it whenever ODL is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaa757339f24fbadf51152326fe62f194c25e2384
(cherry picked from commit dcf0a9a1b95190d323a144a3893ba71c86ab7ba2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 07:30:09.000000000', 'message': "Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

	OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
	oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I256819af5afbacb27c2625b16758781399932d8c
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

	OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
	oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: I256819af5afbacb27c2625b16758781399932d8c

> (2 comments)
Regarding the performance data.

1) RBD-clone happens within the Ceph cluster.
2) "show_image_direct_url=False" implies glance-download which uses a single HTTP GET from a single glance-api daemon which is RBD-connected, IIRC temporary disk writes to cache the image on the cinder node, and following that upload to the RBD pool again.
 
It is impossible for a 2) to be faster than 1) assuming both are well-configured, since it introduces several extra steps serial steps. QED.'}, {'account_id': 11526, 'date': '2017-11-28 12:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-21 08:27:10.000000000', 'message': "Flatten volume from glance rbd image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create a clone volume
from that image, and the relationship is 'glance image-->rbd snap of
glance image-->clone image(=volume from image)' like below.

rbd image 'volume-ac1cc55d-ba36-42c6-b533-4b5e71ffd1e2':
    size 20480 MB in 5120 objects
    order 22 (4096 kB objects)
    block_name_prefix: rbd_data.e0a167539c874
    format: 2
    features: layering, exclusive-lock, deep-flatten
    flags:
    parent: glance-images/8954bdf3-8ad7-4fff-be79-a3dd62a341d0@snap
    overlap: 2252 MB

If we want to remove the dependencies between glance image and
cinder volume, we should flatten the clone image.

So it‚Äôs necessary to add a config option named
rbd_flatten_volume_from_image to decide whether to flatten
rbd clone image or not.
And it is also necessary to call _flatten in clone_image method.
cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py

Change-Id: Iae34d9f69af535fbdcbefb2bbc49ff99d3b6e6a7
Implements: blueprint flatten-volume-from-image
"}]
commit_message:
Flatten volume from glance rbd image

Suppose glance and cinder uses ceph rbd driver as storage backend,
cinder and glance are in the same ceph storage cluster.

If cinder creates a volume from an image, it could create a clone volume
from that image, and the relationship is 'glance image-->rbd snap of
glance image-->clone image(=volume from image)' like below.

rbd image 'volume-ac1cc55d-ba36-42c6-b533-4b5e71ffd1e2':
    size 20480 MB in 5120 objects
    order 22 (4096 kB objects)
    block_name_prefix: rbd_data.e0a167539c874
    format: 2
    features: layering, exclusive-lock, deep-flatten
    flags:
    parent: glance-images/8954bdf3-8ad7-4fff-be79-a3dd62a341d0@snap
    overlap: 2252 MB

If we want to remove the dependencies between glance image and
cinder volume, we should flatten the clone image.

So it‚Äôs necessary to add a config option named
rbd_flatten_volume_from_image to decide whether to flatten
rbd clone image or not.
And it is also necessary to call _flatten in clone_image method.
cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py

Change-Id: Iae34d9f69af535fbdcbefb2bbc49ff99d3b6e6a7
Implements: blueprint flatten-volume-from-image

commit_message:
Tempest jobs: Increase the built timeout for validations

This patch is increasing the BUILD_TIMEOUT in tempest to 300s. That's
the time that tempest will wait until a VM is built and validated (by
ssh'ing into it).

The default timeout for the new RemoteClient class in tempest is 300
just like we are setting it in this patch [0] (see ssh_timeout) but,
the wrapper class that is currently being used by some tests is setting
using the default value in DevStack (which is 196) [1][2][3].

[0]
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/ce4b7d246e09b4dfcd7f9ecef3b2318b010396ac/tempest/lib/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py#L71
[1]
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/e9f3988a57498f8593ff51055be212402fec60ce/lib/tempest#L55
[2]
https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/e9f3988a57498f8593ff51055be212402fec60ce/lib/tempest#L431
[3]
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/ce4b7d246e09b4dfcd7f9ecef3b2318b010396ac/tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py#L46

Partial-Bug: #1796882
Change-Id: I4c3e7822afd4bad4eee4189b946fe6b286e35f83

commit_message:
hardware: remove duplicate memory check

The method '_numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning' is checking total of
physical memory available on the NUMA host against the total
requested. But that check is already done by
'_numa_fit_instance_cell'.

Also that our current check is currently broken since it does not do
the check based on pages. The total of physical memory can be enough,
but for the requested page size by instance that coud not be the
case. A subsequent patch patch will fix this issue.

Partial-Bug: #1594529
Change-Id: I5909c9ceebabedb9dee3b859caa1a514977bd128
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix urllib references

The transition form urllib2 to urllib was not quite right. Some changes were
missing .request and .error from the references.

Change-Id: Icdc0eb7456b5385a0ef3aa67018f7c64985ed7c7
Story: 2000975
Task: 27818
(cherry picked from commit b39994529c011447f6656ea0faf70bb0cfd593a5)

commit_message:
Fix accessing to optional cinder pool attributes

Leave storage pool arguments empty if they are not provided
by cinderclient.

Change-Id: I90435146b33465c8eef95a6104e53285f785b014
Closes-Bug: #1800468

(cherry picked from commit 203db8056881f873348513ce2f3791fa2f1a99e0)

commit_message:
Pass stack name during minor update.

Overcloud minor update fails when stack's name differs.
To bypass it we need pass it to update commands.

Change-Id: Ia6a4792ff8f6214ed6ed87bd79e37266a3a995d5
(cherry picked from commit 203db8056881f873348513ce2f3791fa2f1a99e0)
(cherry picked from commit 8c82c0a80caeac42fa1c7ffe179d270ec2bfc0ee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 13:42:58.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant docstring

The method is quite simple and it doesn't need a dostring.
Also existing docstring was incorrect. The name of the expected
parameter is 'name', not 'node'. And it cannot be an object
of the type node.StorageNode

Change-Id: I94124d327c490d45eae4d2ded218beadfbc33ad7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant docstring

The method is quite simple and it doesn't need a dostring.
Also existing docstring was incorrect. The name of the expected
parameter is 'name', not 'node'. And it cannot be an object
of the type node.StorageNode

Change-Id: I94124d327c490d45eae4d2ded218beadfbc33ad7

commit_message:
Add AdditionalArchitectures when configured

With a heat based deploy we need to add AdditionalArchitectures to the
environment so that consumers can do the right thing when needed.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/580829
Change-Id: I173f3991cda24cd77ccba8a4cfb60c128ecfa3a4

commit_message:
Fix runtime Ansible warnings

- warning from the output by setting no_log for sensitive
variable.
[WARNING]: Module did not set no_log for influxdb_password

- deprecation of "static", using 'import_tasks' for static
inclusions or 'include_tasks' for dynamic inclusions.

Change-Id: I774d59b0d1bf5324c5a8b7c95a06f07299478e6a

commit_message:
Add podman support to validate-tempest role

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/600517 introduces undercloud_container_cli
  to choose docker/podman container runtime. This changes introduces to use
  both docker/podman for running tempest tests.
* Tempest user does not have permission to create tempest workspace let's
  create the tempest workspace and own it with the tempest user.
* Introducing tempest_data directory to keep tempest related data
  which can be used by tempestconf and tempest run to tests
* Cleaned up stuff which is not necessary for tempest container.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614664/

Change-Id: I1b19b2580d1d4c9844e9221f18b23655b36b5a23

commit_message:
Add directories to osd-devices as well

Tracking directory backed OSDs in the kv store allows
us to bootstrap further relations based on bootstrapped
OSD counts.

Change-Id: I1a28a28dbd325dd7ffd74940a07be9908d74689c
Closes-Bug: #1802134

commit_message:
Add container image prepare script to upgrade workflow.

During Q->R upgrade container images have to be prepared after
'overcloud upgrade prepare' command finished.
Same command is used during minor update of Q.

Change-Id: Ibcdcf0e5e2cb0528f142e2d9c8188eda000b20f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-04 02:03:08.000000000', 'message': "Set capsule.host once it is running

If the host is not set, zun-api won't know the location of the
capsule which leads to failure to delete the capsule in multi-node
environment.

Change-Id: Ie131236bb4426e12c5b8424e8eac07677dcb820a
"}]
commit_message:
Set capsule.host once it is running

If the host is not set, zun-api won't know the location of the
capsule which leads to failure to delete the capsule in multi-node
environment.

Change-Id: Ie131236bb4426e12c5b8424e8eac07677dcb820a

messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-11-01 04:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22406, 'date': '2018-11-05 07:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-11-08 06:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 04:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Handle different endpoint format

Depending on a specific deployment of Zun, the API endpoint could
be of various formats. For example:

1. the classic (legacy) endpoint:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/v1/
2. under wsgi:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/container/v1
3. other:
    https://container.example.com/
    https://example.com/container

We need to parse the url correctly in order to get the correct version
URL which is used to determinate the API version.

Change-Id: Ia69959431e2d751d228f4cfc1db74b774bd9d69e
Closes-Bug: #1799343
(cherry picked from commit 14de75e5807cfd055bb2cd8ff09b283cf502d11d)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle different endpoint format

Depending on a specific deployment of Zun, the API endpoint could
be of various formats. For example:

1. the classic (legacy) endpoint:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/v1/
2. under wsgi:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/container/v1
3. other:
    https://container.example.com/
    https://example.com/container

We need to parse the url correctly in order to get the correct version
URL which is used to determinate the API version.

Change-Id: Ia69959431e2d751d228f4cfc1db74b774bd9d69e
Closes-Bug: #1799343
(cherry picked from commit 14de75e5807cfd055bb2cd8ff09b283cf502d11d)

subject: spec-lite: Embed validation data in locations
messages:
[{'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-08-29 20:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-08-30 16:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-08-30 16:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-09-01 00:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-09-14 18:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-09-18 05:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Small nit which needs to be taken care. Everything else is as per discussion during the Stein PTG.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-stein-checksum-hash-at-patch'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-09-18 06:26:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-09-18 06:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-09-18 17:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-09-19 04:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Thanks, everything as per discussed during PTG'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-09-27 15:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-01 16:56:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

This looks like a good solution to me.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-01 21:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

My primary concern about this is that it's a nonstandard use of json-patch.

We will probably have to introduce a new application/openstack-images-v2.2-json-patch MIME type for this.  The problem is that whereas the previous versions "provide a useful and compatible subset of the functionality defined in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch RFC6902" [0], v2.2 will be a subset + extension because the "validation_data" object does not exist in the image/location schema; it's sort of an instruction, really, that produces a side effect (the population of other properties on that image).  Now I realize that my suggestion to smuggle this stuff in with the location metadata isn't all that different; instead of the items being patched directly into the location metadata object, they will have the side effect of populating other image properties.  However, from a syntactic point of view, location-metadata-smuggling would be "just like" a normal PATCH call.  I'm thinking here primarily of the glanceclient, which uses the json-patch library; if we do something weird, that library won't be able to handle it.  (I can't remember whether the library uses the image schema to generate the patch JSON that it uses to call Glance or not.)

The most correct way to do this (much as I hate to say it) is probably to allow PATCH of /checksum, /os_hash_algo, and /os_hash_value under very specific circumstances, namely, the image is in status == queued and a location is being set.  That way we'll just be using the normal semantics of json patch and won't have to introduce a new MIME type.  It's also a bit more clear about what's going on than location-metadata-smuggling.


[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/api/v2/http-patch-image-api-v2.html'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-01 23:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I have actually implemented this spec - both API side (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597368/5/) and glanceclient (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602794/1/). It does work.

I do agree, however, that patching the individual items seems like the right way... but it requires removing the read-only flag from those items in the schema. I thought that's a can of worms that needed to remain closed. I've prototyped an implementation (which checks that the image status is 'queued'). It seems straightforward enough. Would need to check for all other avenues that might allow those previously-read-only attrs to be modified, though..."}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-02 02:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Prototype implementation: http://paste.openstack.org/show/731214/

Comments?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-03 13:30:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Yes, the readonly properties are a problem.

If we remove checksum and os_hash_* from the readonly list, you're right that we'll need to do a careful analysis of test coverage to make sure they aren't modified illicitly.

On the other hand, I noticed that in your patch, 'id' is in the readonly list, and we do allow it to be set upon image creation (but at no other time).

The 'id' is *not* listed as readOnly in the image schema, though.  So maybe the thing to do is to remove the readOnly status in the image schema for the 3 properties, but leave them in the readonly list for internal purposes.  That way we shouldn't have to worry about them suddenly being modifiable by code that previously couldn't.

An objection to this proposal is that removing the readOnly status of these properties in the schema will give users the wrong impression.  But I think that users have been able to deal with the non-readOnly status of the image id just fine ... nobody expects to be able change their image id after it's created.  So the same should hold here.

I don't think this would be a backward-compatibility problem because this would be a "widening" change.

To make this clear to operators and end users, we could introduce the notion of "controlled" properties in the documentation.  These are properties that are controlled by Glance and can only be modified under specific circumstances.  We could even add something to the schema, like "controlled": "true" for these properties.

I personally think this is a better proposal than implementing a nonstandard json-patch protocol.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-03 14:12:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Discussed this briefly with cdent in the #openstack-sdks channel [0].

His feeling is that if we use json-patch 'replace' operation, it should actually replace something.  So direct patch of /checksum etc is probably the way to go here.  He did say that if we're only allowing the properties to be changed under this one specific circumstance, we could keep them as readOnly: true in the schema, but that depends on how we're using the schema.  (I personally think it would be safer to remove readOnly, but I wanted to mention what Chris said.)

[0] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2018-10-03.log.html#t2018-10-03T13:31:04"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-05 03:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I took a crack at revising this along the lines we discussed at today's Glance meeting: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-spec-lite-stein-locations-with-checksum"}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-11 03:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Sorry, hit the button too soon.  I think the content is fine, just two typos I noticed and and a rewording suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Thanks. Embarrassed about the typos. It was late, but I wanted to get something up for review before the meeting:)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-11 17:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-11 20:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Updates look good to me.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-12 05:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Looks good, thank you'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-12 12:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Question inline.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-12 15:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

All my concerns have been addressed.  Thanks, Iain.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-18 17:13:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-10-19 11:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)

Couple of comments inline. If majority is willing to let the user swing with what ever algo they wish I can live with that. Also the comment there can be clarified on the implementation.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:55:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Downgrading to +1 because I agree with Erno on the issue of algorithm choice.

It's currently up to the operator to select the os_hash_algo--that's how the multihash feature was designed--and we should respect that.  We certainly don't want users using weaker algorithms than the one the operator has selected.

As far as image consumers go, I think we should trust the operator to determine what algorithm is best suited for the user environment.  The operator is in a position to make sure that all image-consuming openstack services have the selected algorithm available, and is also likely to select something that consumers of that cloud should have available.

So, if we go that route, how does a user discover what os_hash_algo is configured?
(1) if a PATCH is rejected due to incorrect algo, return a 409 and state what algo is expected in the error message
(2) implement a v2/info/os_hash_algo call that returns the value
(3) the cloud operator mentions this somewhere in local docs (which would be nice, but we can't rely upon it)

I think (1) would be satisfactory for this spec.  (2) could be part of a longer-term initiative to beef up the /v2/info endpoint (it would be helpful to have other calls, for example, /v2/info/container_format, /v2/info/disk_format, and something like /v2/info/limits that would return JSON object describing stuff like max image size, etc.).

Let's see what Sean and Abhishek think about this particular point.  I'm willing to have my mind changed, but I think there are pretty good reasons for keeping the os_hash_algo uniform within a deployment.

BTW, a user-friendly bonus is that if a user mistakenly specifies 'sha521' or 'sah512' for the os_hash_algo, it will be rejected immediately."}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-19 18:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-19 23:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

Sorry if I was unclear earlier about my reasoning.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-10-22 15:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-24 21:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

This reflects what we've discussed in #openstack-glance and on the etherpad https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-spec-lite-stein-locations-with-checksum"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me, better to get rid of whitespaces.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-10-25 17:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-26 06:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-31 18:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Comment inline.  LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-11-07 17:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

GR8 ... thanks for your patience and all the input everyone.'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-11-07 17:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-11-08 05:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Approving directly after rebase'}]

Bump openstack service version rocky

Update keystone from 14.0.0 to 14.0.1

Update neutron from 13.0.1 to 13.0.2

Update nova from 18.0.2 to 18.0.3

commit_message:
Add action plugins and modules to coverage report

Currently, the coverage report only includes the kolla_ansible python
module, which only includes the kolla-genpwd command, and that is not
tested.

Change-Id: I16f0e9e0f47914b7ce24bbb515d59e4750228821

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 05:44:50.000000000', 'message': "Add organization-guide stub

This patch adds an initial stub version of the new organization
guide. The purpose of this guide is to be something an employee
charged with contributing to OpenStack can take to their employer.
Describing things they may need to take into consideration to
help make the engagement fruitful and rewarding for everyone
involved.

At the moment I've just named it the organization guide. The
could be a better name. This document is a work in progress.

This came out of discussions the First Contact SIG had at the
Vancouver Forum[1]. Originially this discussion started a few months
before[2]. Fungi's post to the mailinglist sums it up much better
then I can[3].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Reqs-for-Organisations-Contributing-to-OpenStack
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Contributing_Organization_Guide
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2018-June/000410.html

Change-Id: I9a48879959786f7f3883eec861cd5ca62ec90dcf

commit_message:
Add organization-guide stub

This patch adds an initial stub version of the new organization
guide. The purpose of this guide is to be something an employee
charged with contributing to OpenStack can take to their employer.
Describing things they may need to take into consideration to
help make the engagement fruitful and rewarding for everyone
involved.

At the moment I've just named it the organization guide. The
could be a better name. This document is a work in progress.

This came out of discussions the First Contact SIG had at the
Vancouver Forum[1]. Originially this discussion started a few months
before[2]. Fungi's post to the mailinglist sums it up much better
then I can[3].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Reqs-for-Organisations-Contributing-to-OpenStack
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Contributing_Organization_Guide
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2018-June/000410.html

Change-Id: I9a48879959786f7f3883eec861cd5ca62ec90dcf

commit_message:
Use system protocol assigments for iptables protocol map

Merge the system protocol assignments into the iptables name
to protocol mapping array, IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_NAME_MAP, so that
systems with updated or new values in /etc/protocols can
successfully install iptables rules.

This was done as an IptablesFirewallDriver() instance mapping
since there is typically only a single instance per-agent,
and it also allows us to more easily unit test it.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py

Change-Id: Ib73def4e2a9e3644462fdee312768382fcb800a5
Closes-Bug: #1783378
(cherry picked from commit 034db863a02ce38a520e4b8aa3a65e1ccdb37f30)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 07:17:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rally deployment config to rally 1.2.0

This PS fixed rally deployment config to latest format. After rally
refactoring, the deployment config format has been simplified, and the
old format is no longer available. The rally deployment config used by
the helm-toolkit also needs to be changed to support the latest rally.

Change-Id: I286f3c8e3ecd8cc7c26273fa7a1be7cc0bf31c4b
Related-Id: I380a976c0f48c4af0796c9d866fc8787025ce548
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rally deployment config to rally 1.2.0

This PS fixed rally deployment config to latest format. After rally
refactoring, the deployment config format has been simplified, and the
old format is no longer available. The rally deployment config used by
the helm-toolkit also needs to be changed to support the latest rally.

Change-Id: I286f3c8e3ecd8cc7c26273fa7a1be7cc0bf31c4b
Related-Id: I380a976c0f48c4af0796c9d866fc8787025ce548

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I8ffd6916ac6eb1192466ce4973898f8ec8d67d49

[{'created': '2018-03-13 05:21:07.000000000', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I819dbc7601135b3388972c56a3c1007a5466d652
'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I819dbc7601135b3388972c56a3c1007a5466d652

commit_message:
Add abstract method in trusts base.py

This is a follow-up patch to add an abstract
method for flush_expired_and_soft_deleted_trusts
in base.py to avoid any burst in case people
supplying their own backend.

Change-Id: Ib326abddce239e87cd4cd37d06fa3b55112ee134
Related-Patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589378/
Related-Bug: #1473292

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents
are normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic525ec30f0250351eff473034f4cc8d35e0b49b6
'}]
commit_message:
Import Zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents
are normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic525ec30f0250351eff473034f4cc8d35e0b49b6

commit_message:
Support HA container tagging with podman

Use container_cli instead of hardcoding docker. It'll allow us to use
Podman on the overcloud when Pacemaker is enabled.

commit_message:
Remove unused networks from OpenShift roles

The StorageMgmt and Tenant networks are not used in an OpenShift
context and should hence be removed from the OpenShift roles.

Change-Id: I06951742cd4e1e203e95d49ffe1b7404f75fca70

commit_message:
Add network data for use with openshift deployments

Provide a network data file with only the External, InternalApi and the
Storage networks for use with OpenShift deployments.

Take out the IPv6 addresses from the network data until OpenShift can
be deployed in an IPv6 environment.

This also disables the validation for the network_data_openshift.yaml
since it expects network_data files to only add new networks to the
existing pre-defined overcloud networks and we're doing the opposite
here -- only keeping a subset of the networks.

Change-Id: I6d8c08c12ae9002e6386f26c5a8bcf70b8eda4b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 13:30:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix api version handling, which completely breaks the client

The neutron client does not work with recent openstacksdk versions
(>=0.18.0): http://paste.openstack.org/raw/734040/

This change addresses a mismatch in the api version format.
The neutron client passes a dict while the openstack sdk expects a
string.

Change-Id: I33c868f1c1e40d7673ba6651abedf3dfe0850660
Closes-Bug: #1801360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api version handling, which completely breaks the client

The neutron client does not work with recent openstacksdk versions
(>=0.18.0): http://paste.openstack.org/raw/734040/

This change addresses a mismatch in the api version format.
The neutron client passes a dict while the openstack sdk expects a
string.

Change-Id: I33c868f1c1e40d7673ba6651abedf3dfe0850660
Closes-Bug: #1801360

commit_message:
Use authorize instead of enforce for policy

The authorize function actually checks that the policy we're evaluating
has been registered. Since we do use policy-as-code, we can safely use
this method which is preferred.

Change-Id: I429e56c51f08ad3856f8822479747410c417b9a9

commit_message:
use context manager from neutron-lib

Access to neutron.db.api's context manager is already in neutron-lib
and in fact neutron is already using it as a shim. This patch switches
over context manager access to use neutron-lib's accessors.
Also see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613122

Change-Id: Ie578545698a5ac59f43633d9a56a508bbe56c179

commit_message:
Make tox -ereleasenotes work

One of the things Placement will need when it is properly publishing
itself is a working release notes job. Until this change there was
no source/conf.py or source/index.rst for releasenotes job to use.
This adds it, we can now create release notes output, with the
openstackdocs theme.

However: Because the placement repo has no branches, all the existing
release notes in releasenotes/notes are considered 'unreleased', which
makes for a lot of noise at the page generated by unreleased.rst.

What this probably means is that we will want to clear out all the
release notes that pre-date extraction and start anew. An experiment to
try removing some notes shows that the releasenotes will produce some
messages about missing release notes, but neither warn nor error, and
the output is good, so this should work out okay for us.

That will be easy to do now that we have a working releasenotes tox env.

Note: This change does not add any jobs to zuul, it just makes tox
work for releasenotes.

Change-Id: I61a7ce492395e0ae69dd0401a141ea4bb93516b9

commit_message:
Remove stale pip-check-reqs tox test

pip-check-reqs tool is no longer maintained and has broken with
release 10 of pip.

Refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: Ie4e059c15b09630dc82f911c5a3b6278a72e0744
"}]
commit_message:
Replace usage of get_legacy_facade() with get_engine()

We've been seeing warnings emitted to the python 3 unit tests:

  OsloDBDeprecationWarning: EngineFacade is deprecated; please use
  oslo_db.sqlalchemy.enginefacade

which stem from our use of the get_legacy_facade() oslo.db method.

This replaces the get_legacy_facade() usage with the get_engine()
method from the transaction context manager.

The same has been done for Nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606213

Change-Id: Ie4e059c15b09630dc82f911c5a3b6278a72e0744

commit_message:
Make CLUSTER_DELETE action ignore conflicts/locks

When cluster/node actions were updated to reject when there is a
conflict/lock we broke the way CLUSTER_DELETE could steal the
lock from a cluster. This changes makes CLUSTER_DELETE actions
able to steal locks and ignore conflicts. However a
CLUSTER_DELETE action can conflict with another CLUSTER_DELETE.

Change-Id: Ia771449c76d0d7bb07ffc0cc37317f47f900db48
Closes-Bug: 1800549

commit_message:
Ensure pip/setuptools/wheel are up to date in the utility venv

To ensure consistency, we make sure that the venv used for the
utility container has an up to date and the right versions of
pip/setuptools/wheel.

Without this, on some distributions, we get an obscure error
stating that the wheels from the repo are not compatible with
the python version.

We also update the repo_build role SHA to include the following
patches for a similar reason:
https://review.openstack.org/615213
https://review.openstack.org/615525
https://review.openstack.org/615876

Finally, due to changes in the rabbitmq yum repo GPG keys, we
also need to update the rabbitmq_server repo SHA to include
the update for that:
https://review.openstack.org/616218

Change-Id: Id66ca539984683d7340b50d3f4364c7836251881

The best option is to leave the connected router namespaces in place until all the VMs in the host is gone.
