will check that out. I don't think the changes we made should affect the extra routes, but let me check that out."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-09 21:52:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

@slawek yes I verified it. It is true that when dvr_ha routers are configured the 'extra-routes' is not being configured in the router namespace. I wonder that we might be missing a function override with HA enabled that configures the routes."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-09 23:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

@slawq You may need to do this, to solve the problem with dvr-ha not able to update the nexthop routes. ( Probably we should open a new bug to address this issue)

l3/ha_router.py should call 'super' for routes_updated as shown.
 def routes_updated(self, old_routes, new_routes):
        instance = self._get_keepalived_instance()
        instance.virtual_routes.extra_routes = [
            keepalived.KeepalivedVirtualRoute(
                route['destination'], route['nexthop'])
            for route in new_routes]
        super(HaRouter, self).routes_updated(old_routes, new_routes)


Also l3/dvr_edge_ha_router should override this function below:

def update_routing_table(self, operation, route):
        super(DvrEdgeHaRouter, self).update_routing_table(operation, route)"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2018-10-10 06:14:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

 > instance.virtual_routes.extra_routes = [

 > super(DvrEdgeHaRouter, self).update_routing_table(operation, route)

Something steps copied from patch set 23:

Step 1: create the test scenario described in the LP bug description
Those creation steps...

The router info http://paste.openstack.org/show/732315/

Step 2Ôºö remove one router (AP1-RT) from private Site (AP1Site)
$ openstack router remove subnet AP1-RT AP1_sub

Remove router AP1-RT interface from subnet AP1_sub, you should still see 2 router namespaces in the compute node.
But patch set 26 has something seems not correct, after this step, I can see the AP2-RT namespace will not exist in compute node, this is `ip netns` log in compute node:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/732313/ line 20 - line 121

Step 3: Concurrently adding one router (AP2-RT) to another Site (site_3) and removing router (AP1-RT) from Wan_sub, 
$ openstack router add subnet 9934e360-2ad6-4cb8-a315-7ae99f3fb2e3 77b01132-0341-42d3-8b0c-e20a433ce931 & openstack router remove subnet 1d47934d-c4c7-44bf-8002-2bc36a492053 c8b119d4-16dd-4467-8ea2-3273f342022b &
After this step, the AP2-RT namespace is back, and AP1-RT namespace is deleted.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/732313/ line 146 - line 204

But I can see another interesting phenomenon, during step 2 and step 3, I noticed that the AP1-RT and AP2-RT qrouter namespace will be deleted and recreate then during the processing. This seems not acceptable due to the connection down time.
See these lines here:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/732313/ line 21, line 23, line 125 - 140'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-17 16:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Workflow-1

I just pushed new PS. I did tests like:

1. Deploy scenario described in bug report (2 routers connected to each other with tenant network)

2. Then I did operations like:

$ openstack router add subnet AP1-RT AP3Site_sub
$ openstack router remove subnet AP1-RT AP3Site_sub
$ openstack router remove subnet AP1-RT AP1Site_sub
$ openstack router add subnet AP1-RT AP1Site_sub
$ openstack router remove subnet AP1-RT WAN_Sub
$ openstack router add subnet AP1-RT WAN_Sub

In all cases proper router/interface was added removed and I didn't notice any flapping of other routers.

Please check it also if You have time LIU Yulong :)"}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

Sorry, for patch set 29, I can still see router namesapce left on the compute node, even it does not have any subnet interface.
My test is like this, routers and VMs are set on same compute node:
1. AP1-RT router does not have any subnet connection
2. AP2-RT router is connected to WAN, AP2_sub and AP3_sub (3 router interface here)
3. Add AP1-RT router interface to subnet AP1_sub (until here, AP1-RT does not connect to WAN_sub)
4. then use the following command:
$ openstack router remove subnet 1d47934d-c4c7-44bf-8002-2bc36a492053 6a795217-5cce-4d7f-9492-6801652f17df & openstack router add subnet 1d47934d-c4c7-44bf-8002-2bc36a492053 c8b119d4-16dd-4467-8ea2-3273f342022b & openstack router remove subnet 9934e360-2ad6-4cb8-a315-7ae99f3fb2e3 77b01132-0341-42d3-8b0c-e20a433ce931 & openstack router remove subnet 1d47934d-c4c7-44bf-8002-2bc36a492053 c8b119d4-16dd-4467-8ea2-3273f342022b &
It is doing such thing:
(1) remove AP1-RT router subnet from AP1_sub
(2) add AP1-RT router interface to WAN_subnet
(3) remove AP2-RT router subnet from AP3_sub
(4) remove AP1-RT router subnet from WAN_subnet
You may see router AP1-RT namespace left here, if not, try to run the test again.


Let's make the test a bit simple:
1. AP1-RT router does not have any subnet connection
2. AP2-RT router is connected to WAN, AP2_sub and AP3_sub (3 router interface here)
Then, run the following action parallelly:
(2) add AP1-RT router interface to WAN_subnet
(3) remove AP2-RT router subnet from AP3_sub
(4) remove AP1-RT router subnet from WAN_subnet
Also, you may see router AP1-RT namespace left here, if not, try to run the test again.


So, this seems the race condition I mentioned before in the l3 agent side. Please confirm in your local env.
Thanks."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:31:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

 > (3) remove AP2-RT router subnet from AP3_sub
 > (4) remove AP1-RT router subnet from WAN_subnet
 > Also, you may see router AP1-RT namespace left here, if not, try to
 > run the test again.
 > 
 > 
 > So, this seems the race condition I mentioned before in the l3
 > agent side. Please confirm in your local env.
 > Thanks.

Ok, I was able to reproduce this issue locally. I used simple script: http://paste.openstack.org/show/732964/ to reproduce this.
With PS 30 (changed priorities of update events it happens less often but still it can happen.

I found that it is indeed race between update workers. Log (with some custom log lines added by me) can be found here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/732965/

Basically what happens here is that R1 is removed from host as it got "remove router" rpc message from server but other worker was already doing "update" of this router as related to R2. And this "related update" was finished after R1 was already removed. So it's added again.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/597567/30 : SUCCESS in 1h 37m 15s'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

I also see some issue with the Delete logic, where all the namespaces are not removed, after I removed the interfaces that are connected to VMs.'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

(1 comment)

Swami - I've been working on an update that might fix the problem you saw, there is a race condition where the namespace might get re-created.  Can you tell me if the namespace is there but empty?

Slaweq is currently testing the update and if it passes locally I'll upload it."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-10-24 19:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-24 20:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

For now, I did not try to test this with 'delete' actions yet. But, it is important for us to test it.
The test scenarios I can think of are:
1. connect router AP2_RT to AP3_SUB; remove AP1_RT router from WAN, (it does not have any subnet connection now); delete router AP1_RT
2. delete VM AP1 from AP1_subnet; connect router AP2_RT to AP3_SUB; remove AP1_RT from WAN
3. delete VM AP1 from AP1_subnet; connect router AP2_RT to AP3_SUB;  create VM to AP1_subnet;  remove AP1_RT from WAN
Yes, mix these actions, test and test."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-10-25 21:50:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31:

Thx for Your review and feedback guys.
Unfortunately I still can see sometimes (very rare but it happens) issues with not removed router when doing it in parallel like LIU described.

I found that there is still an issue on agent's side which can lead to it. What happens sometimes is:

1. update R2 arrives
2. delete R1 arrives
3. worker starts updating R2,
4. worker starts deleting R1,
5. worker from point 3 queues update for R1
6. worker from point 4 deleted R1,
7. "new" worker creates R1 again

We will continue investigating this with Brian...'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-10-26 21:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

'}, {'created': '2018-09-18 13:48:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix connection between 2 dvr routers

In case when 2 dvr routers are connected to each other with
tenant network, those routers needs to be always deployed
on same compute nodes.
So this patch changes dvr routers scheduler that it will create
dvr router on each host on which there are vms or other dvr routers
connected to same subnets.

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <SVasudevan@suse.com>

Closes-Bug: #1786272

Change-Id: I579c2522f8aed2b4388afacba34d9ffdc26708e3

commit_message:
Fix connection between 2 dvr routers

In case when 2 dvr routers are connected to each other with
tenant network, those routers needs to be always deployed
on same compute nodes.
So this patch changes dvr routers scheduler that it will create
dvr router on each host on which there are vms or other dvr routers
connected to same subnets.

Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <SVasudevan@suse.com>

Closes-Bug: #1786272

Change-Id: I579c2522f8aed2b4388afacba34d9ffdc26708e3

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: Ifb87c315953a02291201a25aff05910149023d10

commit_message:
Create a reproducer-quickstart dir

The reproducer should use toci_quickstart,
toci_gate_test and related functions with the
same variables as the CI job.

This review creates a directory to copy those
ready templates for use when running the reproducer.

Change-Id: I1480a42bd78577fe2d2fb34981a2b02889b37ead
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/271

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I7c5c82eafead89c165dd7c131fff82b722b20cb1
Related-Bug: #1802144
(cherry picked from commit f8972f763cc1b7fc499714593957435c1d539a75)

commit_message:
Switch stable scenarios to voting

In master we have removed these from the gate as they are non-voting
because we plan on replacing them with standalone versions. However for
stable branches we will want to leave these as voting since they are
defined in the gate in the branch layout.

Change-Id: I7c5c82eafead89c165dd7c131fff82b722b20cb1
Related-Bug: #1802144
(cherry picked from commit f8972f763cc1b7fc499714593957435c1d539a75)

commit_message:
Modify provider_network plugin to compare group_binds to group_names

This patch compares group_binds of a given OSA provider network to the
group membership of a host to ensure the respective Neutron provider
network is configured only on matching hosts.

Change-Id: Idd13195b7f5c23badb21542dd83ab2898aae16d5
Partial-Bug: #1787462

commit_message:
Provides group_names for use with provider_network plugin

This patch will provide group_names to the provider network object,
which will then be used to compare group_binds for selective
provider network placement across nodes.

Change-Id: I2964366ecc9052582d6eb39d1caf81027fa58271
Partial-Bug: #1787462
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/592661

Previously, we'd sometimes shove strings into HASH_PATH_PREFIX or

commit_message:
Clean up HASH_PATH_* patching

Previously, we'd sometimes shove strings into HASH_PATH_PREFIX or
HASH_PATH_SUFFIX, which would blow up on py3. Now, always use bytes.

Change-Id: Icab9981e8920da505c2395eb040f8261f2da6d2e

commit_message:
Add Monasca Grafana image

This provides support for building the Monasca fork of Grafana
which features Keystone integration.

It is primarily for use with the Monasca Grafana datasource, although
other datasources can be installed if required.

In the future it would be more efficient to build and host the packages
externally.

Implements: blueprint monasca-grafana
Change-Id: I6cb175868d1993ae31700de36b721f4833c4164b

commit_message:
Increase timout of gate jobs

In patch [1] timeout for
- tempest-full
- tempest-full-py3
was increaced to 3h.
Unfortunatelly it was done only for check queue.
I forgot to do the same change for jobs in gate queue

This patch adds same change for gate queue.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614423/

Change-Id: I263124aa732efea8295313aeff7697b91c00f3f4

commit_message:
zuul: Use all rather than all-plugin for tox_envlist

Since 'all-plugin' is deprecated in Tempest, this is to
switch to 'all' instead in .zuul.yaml; for more info,
see: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/9b4c50cf634cbea6e6a7353fff14c2f0a7ab1aa2/tox.ini#L64

Depends-On: Ib3264f54075216471720483c8dd816887c1f413c
Change-Id: I440b6cff2b5378e18304017589e3e7cf4748c28c

This reverts commit 5c2859c3e9026e464bf0c35b591aaae810ff2a1c.

commit_message:
Revert "Fix rally deployment config to rally 1.2.0"

This reverts commit 5c2859c3e9026e464bf0c35b591aaae810ff2a1c.

This commit breaks the ability to declare users to use with rally/helm test - and needs to be refactored to match the commit message's intent.

Change-Id: I2bc66ef40694c277058b4324b8a3528f4f25d1d1

commit_message:
Consider hostdev devices when building metadata

Previously, device role tagging metadata would only be built for
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface and LibvirtConfigGuestDisk. This didn't
account for passed through PFs, which can also be tagged and appear as
<hostdev> in the libvirt XML. This caused device role tagging to not
work for PFs. This patch adds support for <hostdev> devices to
_build_device_metadata.

NOTE(artom): Queens -> Pike backport is clean, conflicts in
nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py in Queens due to trusted
VFs not being present.

Change-Id: I24e5ff1b446f2ac41d589c026ce8ee8adad4bcbc
Closes-bug: 1743458
Closes-bug: 1694183
(cherry picked from commit abd01a757b8a83d714a6ab8b5085e7cc1b4a2c5c)
(cherry picked from commit e57f66a26daf858d1348c8406108a33a323b7b2e)

commit_message:
Refactor _build_device_metadata

This patch splits out interface and disk metadata generation into its
own function each, in preparation for handling hostdev metadata
generation in a subsequent patch. It also adds some debug logging.

NOTE(artom): Queens -> Pike backport is clean, conflicts in
nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py in Queens due to trusted VFs not being
present.

Related-bug: 1743458
Change-Id: I318b9118c97d7bf2b61bc45698443e8d0255ff6f
(cherry picked from commit d16d0d553b20fd45a83cf7c68bc477b97aece9a1)
(cherry picked from commit 0f253ea9c5f3f3d97bc049f00d1bcdf2761f0736)

commit_message:
Set ansible's default branch to devel

This is, in fact, the default branch for that project, rather than
'master', so tell Zuul about that so that it checks out the "right"
one by default.

Change-Id: Ie029b7e0e0e2430a4555c8ed198bf370054af428

commit_message:
Use vendored RPM GPG keys for RabbitMQ

It seems that the URLs which are being used to deploy the GPG
keys from are not reliable and they could possibly change, this
patch moves them within the repository to make sure that they
are always accessible.

This is a re-implementation rather than a backport - the Stein
(aka master) branch only uses the 'distro' install method, so
this code path is not exercised.

Change-Id: I28199ce149f6893d688d11177ec950b17dbf0886

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 12:51:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add openstacklib to requirements in metadata.json

There is a constraints in (atleast) Puppet 5 that to
use new ruby api functions the module must have a requirement
for the module that serves those functions.

Testing to add it here to resolve the openstacklib unknown function
bug that was introduced.

This constraints was dropped in Puppet 6.0.0.

Change-Id: Ie0c4c719befe854422ec1893f4f2dcba36fa7777
Related-Bug: 1802083
'}]
commit_message:
Add openstacklib to requirements in metadata.json

There is a constraints in (atleast) Puppet 5 that to
use new ruby api functions the module must have a requirement
for the module that serves those functions.

Testing to add it here to resolve the openstacklib unknown function
bug that was introduced.

This constraints was dropped in Puppet 6.0.0.

Change-Id: Ie0c4c719befe854422ec1893f4f2dcba36fa7777
Related-Bug: 1802083

In oslo_service/__init__.py we only fall back to the library if there's no monotonic function available natively. However, in oslo_service/periodic_task.py we import it unconditionally.

For now monotonic is still getting installed, but if it gets limited to <py3.3 in upper-constraints.txt in the future, this will break.

http://logs.openstack.org/13/616013/1/check/openstack-tox-py35/eb2b127/tox/py35-1.log"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-07 14:51:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-11-06 21:47:37.000000000', 'message': "Limit monotonic to py2

A recent requirements change [1] restricted monotonic to <py3.3, meaning
that any subsequent change triggering the requirements-check job will
fail until that's synced. Do that.

[1] Ib8c1bf08f5fa7463911602b0df19315907c81e04

Change-Id: I3b24a089b780aac2746f48f7d5b538546ccce982
"}, {'created': '2018-11-06 23:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Limit monotonic to py2

A recent requirements change [1] restricted monotonic to <py3.3, meaning
that any subsequent change triggering the requirements-check job will
fail until that's synced. Do that.

[1] Ib8c1bf08f5fa7463911602b0df19315907c81e04

Change-Id: I3b24a089b780aac2746f48f7d5b538546ccce982
"}, {'created': '2018-11-07 15:34:55.000000000', 'message': "Limit monotonic to py2

A recent requirements change [1] restricted monotonic to <py3.3, meaning
that any subsequent change triggering the requirements-check job will
fail until that's synced. Do that.

In order to make this sane, we need to be sure we're only using
monotonic if it's available. In oslo_service.__init__.py, we're using
the actual library if eventlet is. In periodic_task.py we're using the
actual library if the monotonic() method isn't available in the time
module.

[1] Ib8c1bf08f5fa7463911602b0df19315907c81e04

Change-Id: I3b24a089b780aac2746f48f7d5b538546ccce982
"}]
commit_message:
Limit monotonic to py2

A recent requirements change [1] restricted monotonic to <py3.3, meaning
that any subsequent change triggering the requirements-check job will
fail until that's synced. Do that.

In order to make this sane, we need to be sure we're only using
monotonic if it's available. In oslo_service.__init__.py, we're using
the actual library if eventlet is. In periodic_task.py we're using the
actual library if the monotonic() method isn't available in the time
module.

[1] Ib8c1bf08f5fa7463911602b0df19315907c81e04

Change-Id: I3b24a089b780aac2746f48f7d5b538546ccce982

commit_message:
Fixture to mock loopingcall wait()

Consumers of loopingcall may wish to exercise their code in test cases
without incurring actual wall clock sleep time in their test runs.
Heretofore, this required digging into the internals of the loopingcall
module and mocking something private (or something hidden by something
private).

This patch exposes a public oslo_service.fixture.SleepFixture for this
purpose. It can be maintained opaquely as internals change without
affecting its consumers.

See [1] for (one example of) the motivation behind this change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615724/

Change-Id: I0089c7778957456db66599abffaaad3a5332243c

commit_message:
Increase CI image publish job to 1.5 hours

Currently the job is timing out, and we do not have all Rocky images
published.

Change-Id: I5126dd27ae767c5965b9fdd3f079c7f1bc3034a4
(cherry picked from commit 451d0fc023c9a167364cfa15cead808f74d9ac67)

subject: s3api: Move authenticator logic to separate module
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 00:26:31.000000000', 'message': "WIP: s3api: Move authenticator logic to separate module

I didn't much care for the mix-in strategy for adding v4 support. Plus,
this lets us re-use the v4-signer (at least) later, if/when we add
support for more AWS-like endpoints (such as STS).

For future work: stop doing validation work during S3Request.__init__
(beyond *maybe* raising NotS3Request). swob.Request doesn't raise
anything during __init__; it feels weird that this does.

Change-Id: I3e556f5b88f0e30661b8de59e995760446b71f97
"}, {'created': '2018-10-26 19:23:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP: s3api: Move authenticator logic to separate module

Change-Id: I3e556f5b88f0e30661b8de59e995760446b71f97

"}, {'created': '2018-11-03 00:27:29.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Move authenticator logic to separate module

I didn't much care for the mix-in strategy for adding v4 support. Plus,
this lets us re-use the v4-signer (at least) later, if/when we add
support for more AWS-like endpoints (such as STS).

Adds a new config option, reject_non_aws_authorization, to allow or deny
unrecognized authorization headers. Historically, we've always rejected
such headers (so default is True), which was getting covered by ceph's
s3-tests.

For future work: stop doing validation work during S3Request.__init__
(beyond *maybe* raising NotS3Request). swob.Request doesn't raise
anything during __init__; it feels weird that this does.

Change-Id: I3e556f5b88f0e30661b8de59e995760446b71f97
"}]
commit_message:
s3api: Move authenticator logic to separate module

I didn't much care for the mix-in strategy for adding v4 support. Plus,
this lets us re-use the v4-signer (at least) later, if/when we add
support for more AWS-like endpoints (such as STS).

Adds a new config option, reject_non_aws_authorization, to allow or deny
unrecognized authorization headers. Historically, we've always rejected
such headers (so default is True), which was getting covered by ceph's
s3-tests.

For future work: stop doing validation work during S3Request.__init__
(beyond *maybe* raising NotS3Request). swob.Request doesn't raise
anything during __init__; it feels weird that this does.

Change-Id: I3e556f5b88f0e30661b8de59e995760446b71f97

commit_message:
Implement scenario test for the new instance reservation feature

The current instance reservation test scenario is outdated because it
was written for the old instance plugin, which was removed in the Ocata
release.

This patch replaces it with a scenario test for the new instance
reservation feature.

Change-Id: Id6cb3f3a6471eee70000c42694870609068eba75
Closes-Bug: #1714438

commit_message:
Remove unused Task classes

We haven't used these in a while, but they got missed in the patch that
removed their use.

Change-Id: Ic1ce458942b131aa1c72ee1a85d0688d1883a5cc

commit_message:
Set pipefail during overcloud upgrade tasks.

Without pipefail set, errors are masked by awk. So conditional
blocks are always skipped.

Change-Id: I7dde76c3c2d2741c775c348b71f4ae264cfcfcca

Pure awesomeness you have this working.  +2 for sure, but wondering if the playbooks and roles should move to tripleo-upgrade'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-15 06:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> Pure awesomeness you have this working.  +2 for sure, but wondering
 > if the playbooks and roles should move to tripleo-upgrade

So the playbook cannot move from here as there is interdependence between it and emit release.

As for the role, it could be added to the tripleo-upgarde role (in a standalone directory) easily I think.  Then the playbook in oooq will only be the glue between the two.

The advantage of having it in here is that it's mostly a copy/paste of the standalone role and as such it's easy to track change in one to update the other.  We would loose that coupling if we moved to tripleo-upgrade.  We don't need really need branching as the workflow is very simple and shouldn't change anytime soon.

The advantage of having it in tripleo-upgrade is that all upgrade is in one place.  If standalone becomes a thing by itself (outside of ci and dev) then QE can use it as well.

So I would say, that it should eventually move to tripleo-upgrade for consistency.  But for adoption, ease of development, and avoiding unnecessary delay we should keep it here until we can refactor it using a stable job."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-10-15 07:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

chem please +A when ready thanks"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Workflow+1

Add standalone upgrade role and playbook.

This add the standalone upgrade playbook and its associated role.

readability and avoid new conditionals.

[{'created': '2018-10-30 14:49:30.000000000', 'message': "prometheus ceph.rules changes

With new ceph luminous ceph.rules are obsolete.

Added a new rule for ceph-mgr count

Changed ceph_monitor_quorum_count to ceph_mon_quorum_count

Updated ceph_cluster_usage_highas ceph_cluster_used_bytes,
ceph_cluster_capacity_bytes aren't valid

Updated ceph_placement_group_degrade_pct_high as
ceph_degraded_pgs, ceph_total_pgs aren't valid

Updated ceph_osd_down_pct_high as ceph_osds_down,
ceph_osds_up aren't available, ceph_osd_up is
available but ceph_osd_down isn't. Need to
calculate the down based on count(ceph_osd_up==0)

Removed ceph_monitor_clock_skew_high as the metric
ceph_monitor_clock_skew_seconds isn't  valid anymore

Added new alarms ceph_osd_down, ceph_osd_out

Change-Id: Id68e64472af12e8dadffa61373c18bbb82df96a3

commit_message:
prometheus ceph.rules changes

With new ceph luminous ceph.rules are obsolete.

Added a new rule for ceph-mgr count

Changed ceph_monitor_quorum_count to ceph_mon_quorum_count

Updated ceph_cluster_usage_highas ceph_cluster_used_bytes,
ceph_cluster_capacity_bytes aren't valid

Updated ceph_placement_group_degrade_pct_high as
ceph_degraded_pgs, ceph_total_pgs aren't valid

Updated ceph_osd_down_pct_high as ceph_osds_down,
ceph_osds_up aren't available, ceph_osd_up is
available but ceph_osd_down isn't. Need to
calculate the down based on count(ceph_osd_up==0)
and total osd using count(ceph_osd_metadata)

Removed ceph_monitor_clock_skew_high as the metric
ceph_monitor_clock_skew_seconds isn't  valid anymore

Added new alarms ceph_osd_down, ceph_osd_out

Implements: prometheus ceph.rules changes with new valid metrics
Closes-Bug: #1800548
Change-Id: Id68e64472af12e8dadffa61373c18bbb82df96a3
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

commit_message:
Shift swift segment async code out of adapter

Rather than having a run_async parameter to adapter which impacts what
the request method returns, do the concurrent.futures work in the
segment upload code itself. This is one of the steps towards shifting to
the keystoneauth-based rate limiting.

Change-Id: I0ed6cd566f4c450fedbe14712fc8f3712d736f6a

commit_message:
Use eventlet Event for loopingcall events

This fixes broken logic for finding out how to use green threads. Using
threading.Event with eventlet creates useless load related to timers.

Change-Id: I62e9f1a7cde8846be368fbec58b8e0825ce02079
Closes-Bug: #1798774
(cherry picked from commit c2463470f5e7edad1ffd369a472267d559590495)

commit_message:
Fix default signing_dir for Debian

Under Debian, /var/cache/swift is set with unix rights 0755. This is
a problem when using it as signing dir. Instead, it's much better to
use /var/lib/swift, which is using 0750.

This patch changes the default value to be stored in params.pp, and
which now depends on the OS package type. It also fixes the matching
tests.

Change-Id: I4a73f8fc10a2bb9f62c9597b50d0ea3abe69f36e

commit_message:
fix provides epoch on singlespec based packages & patch levelupdate

without this epoch is never part of provides which fails on comparision
with 'old' epoch based packages

(cherry picked from commit cc903f2bf1a984279d644235d3d3fdcc5967cb8a)

openstack-macros: patch level update for changes to be reflected

this will help the latest changes related to epoch get delivered

(cherry picked from commit d33841a074bcbaf10fa87c7415b63b15950c9362)

Change-Id: I7c36f3d673725a944996488490e21c01adc9a7c1

subject: Prevent IndexError on bad fragment index
messages:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-10-29 06:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-30 17:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25251, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Looks like the right thing to do at this place. I think a file with an invalid frag index should be considered an 'unexpected' file. We log at warning level for these and otherwise ignore them (except for rsync tempfiles), your patch does the same."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-11-06 17:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This change should include a test harness to help exercise this weird state.

It's too bad the OP on lp bug #1772378 didn't respond on the bug report with more information how he got here.  Hopefully he wasn't just renaming fragments on disk!?  I believe old enough rings might have been able to "rebalance" a 14 replica ring with less than 14 devices and part_nodes would return short... I don't think you can do that with rings after 2.6.0

I'm not sure continuing with a warning is better than letting things blow up and alert the operator to take immediate action.  It might be nice to add a per-part exception handler around build_jobs, so we can make process in other parts, but in this case I'm not sure the OP wouldn't have seem the same exception in every part he went looking at.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-11-06 20:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-11-07 00:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-11-07 19:39:25.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Squashed into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615990/ -- Clay says it doesn't make sense without the follow-on :-)"}]

commit_message:
Prevent IndexError on bad fragment index

A more complete fix may involve plumbing policy down to
ECDiskFileManager.validate_fragment_index -- and the caller of that
should probably quarantine anything that raises a DiskFileError during
validation.

Change-Id: I59a1633fcb6f3f8c593f6b118c3267c83946f6e0
Partial-Bug: 1772378

Related-Bug: 1794550
'}, {'created': '2018-11-07 15:36:39.000000000', 'message': 'Do not load dm-multipath module from the container

The module must be loaded from the host directly in order
to avoid any SELinux issues.

There are examples in kolla-ansible and tripleo-heat-templates:

commit_message:
Do not load dm-multipath module from the container

The module must be loaded from the host directly in order
to avoid any SELinux issues.

There are examples in kolla-ansible and tripleo-heat-templates:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605624/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605450/

Change-Id: Ieebb2564e816d83ec4111c211677f0a44488a224
Related-Bug: 1794550

commit_message:
Do not load iscsi_tcp from within a container.

The module must be loaded from the host directly in order
to avoid any SELinux issues.

There are examples in kolla-ansible and tripleo-heat-templates:
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605624/
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605450/

Change-Id: Ica68a109c3ed577e6a339ef315b576061cd557e5
Related-Bug: 1794550

we no longer install Ansible from git checkout (as stable branch is not so stable as we'd hope).

Instead, the 'stable-2.2' will install latest pip release for that series (stable-2.2 -> latest 2.2.x).

Eventually we should remove this ANSIBLE_GIT_BRANCH thing and set the ANSIBLE_PIP_VERSION properly instead (although I'd think the deprecation period of 3m+release boundary still does not allow us to do that right now)"}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2017-05-26 12:49:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Pavlo, can you explain why that can't be done right now? I'm new to the project so not sure I understand the time boundary you're speaking about.

I'd really like to see this get pushed forward to allow for Ansible 2.2 to be the minimum version (2.3 is now out too), as there is functionality that I need in 2.2 that would allow me to break out some duplicate plays across roles into a single role that could be included via include_role."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-05-30 13:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-05-30 13:10:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you! 

So, I'll have to check (by finding Pavlo's code that reworked things), but I think we can rip out the old code potentially at this point. As for updating the version, it seems super reasonable. 

One thing we will want to do is add a new release note to the patch.  If you don't how to create a release note, please ping pretty much anyone in #openstack-ironic."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2017-05-30 13:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add missing step for ovs deploy guides

There was missing step about adding underlying interface to the
provider bridge in ovs deployment guides.
This patch adds this missing step.

Change-Id: I2ef5f12c469647d7f197cb5db71692e68d23f718
Closes-Bug: #1801361

commit_message:
Add overcloud-secure-uefi element

This is the equivalent of the overcloud-secure element,
but is defined to generate images that are capable to boot
from UEFI.

Change-Id: If9e0504438632f1a22b45b7c95e7bfb8cb6f41d3
Depends-On: I2cff0d6b195fcae07fba8b39552149b845f2e1c0
(cherry picked from commit a1d4c352a2c77204c25d9ecaceddf16d91085e64)

commit_message:
Add UEFI support for hardened images

This is not a cherry-pick, but a new commit, because the
patch does not apply cleanly. It follows same structure but it
is adapted to respect the elements and packages needed for
queens version.

Change-Id: I2cff0d6b195fcae07fba8b39552149b845f2e1c0

commit_message:
PY3: Ensure _refresh is passed str type for reason

Drop the use of oslo.i18n's Message class when defining the reason
argument that is passed to _refresh(). Ensuing code that _refresh()
uses, in particular pymysql [1], expects a unicode str type rather
than an oslo_i18n._message.Message type.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/v0.9.2/pymysql/converters.py#L68

Change-Id: Icc59edc8a91ba7ae6929e853f1bf09bd25cdc039
Closes-Bug: #1799406
(cherry picked from commit dbf6d2770dcd97d2ef2939ca735309e44b946c4d)

commit_message:
Set undercloud hostname from ansible variables

This sets the undercloud hostname from ansible variables instead of
having to call hostnamectl. This also sets a domain to the hostname if
needed.

The hostname is set with one of the following cases, in this order of
precedence

* When we have undercloud_cloud_domain defined, we use that for the FQDN
* When we have an FQDN we use that.
* If not, we default to <hostname>.tripleodomain.example.com

Note that these are only used if undercloud_undercloud_hostname wasn't
provided.

Depends-On: I7705744cab62f432e2e09bf1ee88bba809609cda 
Change-Id: I649d6cb87458f2bc9623c84830a45bdcf54432d4
Closes-Bug: #1801769

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 14:40:41.000000000', 'message': 'Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930
'}]
commit_message:
Wait to ipv6 forwarding be really changed by L3 agent

In test test_ha_router_namespace_has_ipv6_forwarding_disabled
functional test it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6
forwarding and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change to master.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 forwarding change.

Change-Id: I85a602561ebe9b7ab135913af49a3f010b09f196
Closes-Bug: #1801930

uses, in particular pymysql [1], expects a unicode str type rather
than an oslo_i18n._message.Message type.

commit_message:
PY3: Ensure _refresh is passed str type for reason

Drop the use of oslo.i18n's Message class when defining the reason
argument that is passed to _refresh(). Ensuing code that _refresh()
uses, in particular pymysql [1], expects a unicode str type rather
than an oslo_i18n._message.Message type.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/v0.9.2/pymysql/converters.py#L68

Change-Id: Icc59edc8a91ba7ae6929e853f1bf09bd25cdc039
Closes-Bug: #1799406

[{'account_id': 16171, 'date': '2018-09-27 12:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16171, 'date': '2018-09-28 11:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16171, 'date': '2018-10-01 04:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2018-10-01 11:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(15 comments)'}, {'account_id': 16171, 'date': '2018-10-02 08:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-11-07 17:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There are still many deployments where Prometheus is not present/needed/wanted.  This change makes the prometheus client a hard requirement. It might be better to explore if this could be done as a plugin or an additional optional module.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-11-07 18:05:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I can see some merit in using Prometheus to monitor a large Monasca deployment. I do wonder if statsd is more appropriate here? Some of the other Monasca components already emit statsd metrics, and there is a statsd exporter for Prometheus which could be used externally without pulling in the Prometheus client here. Irrespective of how it's implemented it will be nice to have these metrics available. Thanks!"}]

subject: Spec Lite: Show Store Info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}, {'_account_id': 28948, 'name': 'Liang Fang', 'email': 'liang.a.fang@intel.com', 'username': 'liang'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-22 05:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:29:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

I think this is a good proposal.  It will be useful to people using the multiple backends feature and won't get in the way of people who aren't using it."}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-23 07:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Agree with Brian, It will be helpful in case of multiple stores.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-23 11:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not entirely sure we want to add another command line arg to get this. Would a regular -v make sense to include this?

I've been looking at python-openstackclient work lately to see what needs to be done to get our legacy CLIs in sync with what is available there. Part of the goal with that CLI is to try to make terminology and usage consistent across the different services. At least as of right now, I think they only have the "--long" option that corresponds to other CLIs "--detail", "-v", and other more verbose switches. If we have separate -v and -vv args, then just trying to think how that would be represented in osc. "--reallylong" doesn't make sense, so likely what would end up happening is the osc client would just always do the equivalent of -vv.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-23 14:35:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Sean: I see what you mean.  I don't like adding this to the current '-v' option because in the regular glance configuration, what you'll see in every row in the stores column is 'default', which isn't very helpful.  Maybe the thing to do here is to have an --include-stores option that would be independent of -v?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I do like the idea of --include-stores. I think that makes it a little more obvious and as a user trying to figure out how to use the CLI, I think the help output will be a little more clear that way.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Deal. Let's add "--include-stores". Thanks rosmaita's idea and sean's thought. Let me update the code accordingly. Thank you guys.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:47:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I'm OK with this proposal."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:28:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

As Erno pointed out in the meeting, need to make it clear that we're exposing only the store ID, not store type via this change."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-25 14:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-10-26 19:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I think this captures what we've agreed on.  Thanks, Liang!"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-29 06:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Updates look good to me.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-11-07 16:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]

commit_message:
Upgrade etcd

We've some issues with etcd and its performance in the gate, resulting
in kubernetes processes exiting. This patch upgrades etcd to see if that
helps with the issue.

Change-Id: Ifd3d95bb000479f2b93f16e60625c49d66273dd4

messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-09-06 20:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM, you even preempted what I thought was going to be an easy -1 on making sure we link to this being an exception and not standard practice.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-07 15:11:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 20:32:12.000000000', 'message': "Document when pre-release upgrade scripts are run

Every time I have to figure out where in the sequence
of upgrade events the per-release within-$base and
from-$base scripts run, I have to dig into the doc.

We have a pretty good document already on the sequence
of phases in a grenade run, but the upgrade section is
pretty fuzzy, and with no mention of when the per-release
scripts run relative to when new code is installed, which
is pretty important if you're going to write one of these
scripts.

So this adds some docs related to when those per-release
upgrade scripts happen relative to installing new code
during the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic79cd10b2df5fa54a13f73cf49c8f73fa93e9381
"}]
commit_message:
Document when pre-release upgrade scripts are run

Every time I have to figure out where in the sequence
of upgrade events the per-release within-$base and
from-$base scripts run, I have to dig into the doc.

We have a pretty good document already on the sequence
of phases in a grenade run, but the upgrade section is
pretty fuzzy, and with no mention of when the per-release
scripts run relative to when new code is installed, which
is pretty important if you're going to write one of these
scripts.

So this adds some docs related to when those per-release
upgrade scripts happen relative to installing new code
during the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic79cd10b2df5fa54a13f73cf49c8f73fa93e9381

published.

commit_message:
Fix blazar-nova Git field names

There are some mispelled and misworded Git field names related to the
Blazar Nova service in change I27874f7 / commit df54583c.  Correct the
Git field names so that the assigned values are recognized.

commit_message:
Deploying multiple Ceph clusters (tenant Ceph)

- This doc ps include guide to setup multiple Ceph clusters
- One Ceph cluster for k8 storage backend (pv)
- Other Ceph cluster for Cinder and Glance storage backend.
- All dependant PS has been merged during Ceph split

Change-Id: I918eb10e7d908b1f879d9011020b6d74ac303eea

commit_message:
Update python-freezerclinet version to 2.0.0

The new version is merged some new features. such as:
 Remove "--os-identity-api-version" argument
 Add backup create client support for freezer
 Add argument: "--os-backup-api-version"
 Add freezerclient.client module in order to use api directly
 ....

Change-Id: Ifa0e62be18dca4830e73ecc6705f832d99846b56

commit_message:
Install centralized floating IP nat rules to all ha nodes

For L3 DVR HA router, the centralized floating IP nat rules are not
installed in every HA node snat namespace. So, install the rules to
all the router snat-namespace on every scheduled HA router host.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py

Closes-Bug: #1793527
Change-Id: I08132510b3ed374a3f85146498f3624a103873d7
(cherry picked from commit ee7660f593f0f997fff457021b3d5feb5c71906d)
(cherry picked from commit 2a1cdf01b58f42bfdf20cccdf7db209493897356)
(cherry picked from commit b93ef2f7e8cded1d9ac35b92bcdb3056a2efab5b)

commit_message:
Change docker-cmd for recent paunch changes

paunch was changed to support podman, it breaks some arguments, and
expectations in our tests. Let's fix that.

Change-Id: I7127cc2edb9af785e0533e0a1e5f2608417390e7

commit_message:
Fix args order for tripleo-repos command

The examples in FFU documentation had the arguments
for <BRANCH> and <REPO> in the wrong order.
Swap the order of arguments based on the official
tripleo documentation:
https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/installation/installation.html

Closes-Bug: #1802097
Change-Id: Id3c7ca5f7f992ea53672212986c3508ae41683da

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Monasca Grafana

The Monasca Grafana fork allows users to log into Grafana with their
OpenStack user credentials and see metrics associated with their
OpenStack project. The long term goal is to enable Keystone support
in upstream Grafana, but this work seems to have stalled.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-grafana
Change-Id: Icc04613b2571c094ae23b66d0bcc38b58c0ee4e1

commit_message:
Support using external DBs in Monasca

This changes allows the user to configure a Monasca database
which may be different from the default database.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Ia905190b8037ecb1782a758c0b65581fe9024bf6

messages:

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 63a77a85df388cc8e884c3d3b6c1b0a69d01c66a'}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-11-04 11:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-11-07 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I realize this patch has been up for only 3 days. Considering that Windows      batch files are broken on this branch and the change only affects Windows batch files, I am going to merge this now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-03 10:00:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Rocky) installation on Windows

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic), the distribution we use for OpenStack Rocky,
uses systemd's rc-local service to handle /etc/rc.local. In order for
the service to run /etc/rc.local, the file must be an executable (i.e.,
a script with a shebang at the top and the permissions set
appropriately). Our current rc.local lacks these properties and our
mechanism for automatically executing scripts is never activated on
Bionic.

This changeset makes the necessary changes.

Fixes Bug 1800975

backport: rocky

Change-Id: Ie5e73cc68b7545d126a6eca06eafc1d1601618a8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Rocky) installation on Windows

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic), the distribution we use for OpenStack Rocky,
uses systemd's rc-local service to handle /etc/rc.local. In order for
the service to run /etc/rc.local, the file must be an executable (i.e.,
a script with a shebang at the top and the permissions set
appropriately). Our current rc.local lacks these properties and our
mechanism for automatically executing scripts is never activated on
Bionic.

This changeset makes the necessary changes.

Fixes Bug 1800975

backport: rocky

Change-Id: Ie5e73cc68b7545d126a6eca06eafc1d1601618a8

commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Rocky) installation on Windows

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Bionic), the distribution we use for OpenStack Rocky,
uses systemd's rc-local service to handle /etc/rc.local. In order for
the service to run /etc/rc.local, the file must be an executable (i.e.,
a script with a shebang at the top and the permissions set
appropriately). Our current rc.local lacks these properties and our
mechanism for automatically executing scripts is never activated on
Bionic.

This changeset makes the necessary changes.

Fixes Bug 1800975

backport: rocky

Change-Id: Ie5e73cc68b7545d126a6eca06eafc1d1601618a8

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0 and tox python3

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: I759c15a238f0e502c12d0ccba226a6cd38692a17

This updates the image tag for the nagios image. This tag reflects
the final removal of the elasticsearch check plugin as well as the
successful merge of the change to correctly run nagios as PID 1

commit_message:
Stop publishing docs

Since dragonflow will not be anymore an official repo, stop publishing to
docs.o.o. Instead only run a job that builds documents.

Related to https://review.openstack.org/613856

Change-Id: Ife84b442b8b7750b8ef761c12939b0496beaceef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 00:47:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update keystonev3_policy.json to enable UI buttons

The horizon interface enables/displays actions based on the
keystonev3_policy.json file provided. The keystonev3_policy.json file
included by the charm has rules for various actions that depend on the
target object's domain id (user, group, project). The buttons displayed
for creating and deleting the objects (shown above the tables) are also
based on these policy rules but no target object exists because they are
bound to the table and not a specific target object.

This patch changes some of the policy rules to create/delete users,
projects, and groups to not require the target object's domain_id. This
is safe to do because the table is shown within the context of the
target domain_id already. Additionally, the actual ability to alter
objects is controlled by the actual policy installed in Keystone and not
the Horizon UI.

Without this change, actions such as "Create User" will only show for
a user who is a cloud admin and not for any domain admins (even if the
domain admin is allowed to perform the action via the API or CLI).

Change-Id: Ie0a85e11e6a171083deb19b0eb26c7e552390c00
Closes-Bug: #1775224
Closes-Bug: #1775229
(cherry picked from commit e10f120a1d5725ce50dbae667a1d66b1100839b7)
'}]
commit_message:
Update keystonev3_policy.json to enable UI buttons

The horizon interface enables/displays actions based on the
keystonev3_policy.json file provided. The keystonev3_policy.json file
included by the charm has rules for various actions that depend on the
target object's domain id (user, group, project). The buttons displayed
for creating and deleting the objects (shown above the tables) are also
based on these policy rules but no target object exists because they are
bound to the table and not a specific target object.

This patch changes some of the policy rules to create/delete users,
projects, and groups to not require the target object's domain_id. This
is safe to do because the table is shown within the context of the
target domain_id already. Additionally, the actual ability to alter
objects is controlled by the actual policy installed in Keystone and not
the Horizon UI.

Without this change, actions such as "Create User" will only show for
a user who is a cloud admin and not for any domain admins (even if the
domain admin is allowed to perform the action via the API or CLI).

Change-Id: Ie0a85e11e6a171083deb19b0eb26c7e552390c00
Closes-Bug: #1775224
Closes-Bug: #1775229
(cherry picked from commit e10f120a1d5725ce50dbae667a1d66b1100839b7)

As of stable/rocky upstream got rid of supervisor and recommends systemd
supervision for the Monasca agent's component services (collector, forwarder,

commit_message:
monasca-agent: switch to systemd supervision

As of stable/rocky upstream got rid of supervisor and recommends systemd
supervision for the Monasca agent's component services (collector, forwarder,
statsd). This commit adds the required systemd services and a systemd target to
tie them together. It also removes the supervisor dependency.

Change-Id: I26c89d3d49e0aa68bae54c5ff120e27292fa0b03
(cherry picked from commit b1c4386be1c381e1c1cd4c0c8dcc66ca908e3999)

commit_message:
Collect files in tripleo_root required for the reproducer

In updating the reproducer to use the new zuul v3 workflow,
we will need to use toci_quickstart and toci_gate_test
and the related functions with the same variables
that are used in the CI run.

This review captures those "ready-rendered" files for
use in the reproducer.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/271

Change-Id: I3d5c2aebb26c8538a19fb95951df6cf43564375b

commit_message:
Sudo is needed to copy logs

We're not capturing the logs as we likely can't
copy the contents of the folder. So lets use
sudo to exec the cp command, and for good measure
we'll pull a list in case there just is nothing
present to be uploaded for logs

Change-Id: I73ad58037518e6d334efe0bad99458a2fabfc047

commit_message:
Fix fetching osprofiler trace-info

Some OSProfiler drivers(redis for example) require special options.
These options should be available via oslo_config, but we need to
initialize them at first.

Also, this patch adds proper logic.

Change-Id: Ic13d39b15971df7ac06f9a6eea9d06b9d063903c

commit_message:
Enable Kibana if Monasca enabled

Monasca uses Kibana for viewing and searching logs. A future commit
will add support for the Monasca Kibana plugin to provide tenant
scoped access to logs.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I42b6a35f9a526ef41ff3d7cfac140fbc5596a524

  "Copying over haproxy haproxy config".
This change fixes the message.

TrivialFix

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 09:09:13.000000000', 'message': "Set containerized_undercloud_upgrade to true

Q to R upgrade is focused on upgrading to containerzied undercloud,
so it worth to make it as default.
If non-containerized upgrade is required aforementioned option

commit_message:
Set containerized_undercloud_upgrade to true

Q to R upgrade is focused on upgrading to containerzied undercloud,
so it worth to make it as default.
If non-containerized upgrade is required aforementioned option
has to be set to false '-e -containerized_undercloud_upgrade=false'

Change-Id: Ieddfe3670b047c0e27b7388373da9aee44a5c2e1
(cherry picked from commit f2beaf862fa6beced22ab9becc021425f2a79558)

I like this but I'm not used to seeing __str__ used with any kind of prettification, I wouldn't mind if this was simplified down to just printing str(self._pool). In fact the StateConnector class already has its own __str__: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/ldappool/tree/ldappool/__init__.py#n126"}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:53:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I'm not really a fan of __str__ having pretification on it like this. I much prefer that to be outside of the object... that said, I'm fine with this as is."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-11-07 13:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-11-01 19:41:52.000000000', 'message': 'Allow pool status to be printed as a table

This patch adds a __str__() method to the ConnectionManager class,
which allows for a nice readible table to be obtained that shows
the current state of the connection pool.  This can be very useful
for troubleshooting or monitoring issues related to connection
pooling.  The table will contain a row for each connection within
the pool, with columns showing the connection slot, connectivity
status, activity status, URI, connection lifetime, and bind DN.
The header row will also indicate the pool size and maximum
connection lifetime setting.

Note that this adds a dependency on the prettytable module.  This
new dependency seems worth it for the nice readible table format
it produces.

Change-Id: If0abfef405d05ecd499bdf6201ff465bd845957b

commit_message:
Allow pool status to be printed as a table

This patch adds a __str__() method to the ConnectionManager class,
which allows for a nice readible table to be obtained that shows
the current state of the connection pool.  This can be very useful
for troubleshooting or monitoring issues related to connection
pooling.  The table will contain a row for each connection within
the pool, with columns showing the connection slot, connectivity
status, activity status, URI, connection lifetime, and bind DN.
The header row will also indicate the pool size and maximum
connection lifetime setting.

Note that this adds a dependency on the prettytable module.  This
new dependency seems worth it for the nice readible table format
it produces.

Change-Id: If0abfef405d05ecd499bdf6201ff465bd845957b

commit_message:
Remove dragonflow ML2 driver

Dragonflow is no longer maintained as an OpenStack project [1]
and has therefore been removed from OpenStack-Ansible as a
supported ML2 driver for neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/613856

Change-Id: Ia7042e5dd697611ef4d9148b6f345d5da887b2c5

commit_message:
lxc: stop mirroring COPR locally on CentOS 7

We no longer need to mirror this locally all the time on all the
machines which includes downloading way too many packages than we
need.

We have mirorring and proxies in place in upstream to avoid these
issues and if we have any problems, we can resort to adding mirrors
or proxies in infra.

If there is network problems with these repositories, they will still
hit us if we're mirroring things.

Change-Id: Idad048de6aef569e0e3b73b09448750cf0a06b16

commit_message:
Drop COPR priority settings

We no longer use priorities within CentOS and we let packages use
the natural priorities.  This task was put in place to restore to
default priority and now that in Rocky this task has been run, it
can be removed and no need to be re-ran as it will be no-op.

Change-Id: Iddf6caf674bba61151c1ed77db95efb0c9f0cf82

commit_message:
[Magnum] Use auth_uri instead of www_authenticate_uri

With www_authenticate_uri set instead of auth_uri, requests to the
Magnum API may fail.

Change-Id: I6c3e7ab697a11fe876340a4b15edae433aab6f92
Closes-Bug: 1802072
Related-Bug: 1793813

commit_message:
Support external Keystone in Monasca

Make it easy to override the Keystone endpoints to support deploying
stand-alone Monasca which can integrate with an externally provided
Keystone instance.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I9ae3b243c792ef88075702b47b62f164a1705c2e

Drop legacy HA tool from being installed

This tool has been deprecated for a long time and slated to be removed
since Ocata.

Change-Id: I7b83d86bafd235556b616221b9be45fd48330059

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29254, 'date': '2018-10-09 06:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27977, 'date': '2018-10-09 08:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add new test cases for network ip availability

New tempest test cases added for showing network
ip availability for an existing network id. Refactor
code for listing network ip availabilities. Move repetitive
code in functions. Remove function _cleanUp_port.

Change-Id: I9b06d5ce709794a8e15d4f8d3c57c9e5b88d41a4

commit_message:
Pass stack name during minor update.

Overcloud minor update fails when stack's name differs.
To bypass it we need pass it to update commands.

Change-Id: Ia6a4792ff8f6214ed6ed87bd79e37266a3a995d5
(cherry picked from commit 203db8056881f873348513ce2f3791fa2f1a99e0)

commit_message:
Remove legacy Ironic driver references

From Rocky, Ironic no longer supports drivers, in favour of hardware
types. Hardware types were already implemented for the overcloud Ironic,
this change ensures that Bifrost configuration is given hardware types
where necessary.

Change-Id: Iea91d2cd88b7566bb9cad20367ec64b9213d8845

commit_message:
Update watcher api command argument

This patch set updates watcher api command argument.
1. os_watcher_api_version to os_infra_optim_api_version
2. OS_WATCHER_API_VERSION to OS_INFRA_OPTIM_API_VERSION

This patch set also updated --os-infra-optim-api-version help message.

Change-Id: I2502377b350b8cabfeba80c68f0569d567d24b3a

commit_message:
Add error log message in FaltWrapper

After installing karbor from source code, with executing
karbor related command, for example 'karbor service-list',
it returns 500 with 'The server has either erred or is
incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500)'.
In karbor api log, we can not find any useful word to point
out where the error occurs. So we should add error message
in FaltWrapper to record the error reason.

Closes-Bug: #1801920

Change-Id: I3e7e00d8a48d5cea38d4fb1ca0e62d558598bf6d

a vlan of 0 is not the same thing as no vlan

i do not think this is a valid fix.
if the neutron flat network is not also not set as vlan transparent i dont think this should be allowed.

ml2/ovs dose not support vlan tranparancy so sending a vlan tagged packet from the guest is invalid unless using vlanawre vms which is not the case here.

have you confirmed that this will have no impact on security goups as i woudl suspect the presence of a vlan header should affect both the openvswtich security gorup driver and iptables.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-26 12:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> a vlan of 0 is not the same thing as no vlan
 >

 > i dont think this should be allowed.

 > ml2/ovs dose not support vlan tranparancy so sending a vlan tagged
 > packet from the guest is invalid unless using vlanawre vms which is
 > not the case here.
 > 
 > have you confirmed that this will have no impact on security goups
 > as i woudl suspect the presence of a vlan header should affect both
 > the openvswtich security gorup driver and iptables.

Only thing which I'm changing here is that now ovs will not match packets based on DEI bit in 802.1q header. Nothing else. VLAN ID (last 12 bits still need to be the same as it was before this patch).
If there is any issue with security groups and such filters as You are suspecting, IMO it should be reported as separate bug and solved in different patch."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-26 12:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

One more thing. Very detailed explanation of reason for this change is in https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1635909'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-10-26 12:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1635909#c14'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-30 10:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24042, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:52:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Is it possible in neutron to create VLAN provider networks with tag 0? I guess that this would be the valid and supported workaround for the customer then instead of this patch.

The customer's concern is that they otherwise have to go into their end-customer systems every time a support case is generated and change the switch configuration.

Imagine the end customer has a trunk port on the switch that connects to our controller node. Somebody on the internet may tag the port as EF. That EF IPv4 packet will be set as COS 5 on all switches in the corporate network. If end customers don't instruct their switches to drop the IPv4 EF (or COS) somewhere in their network, that tag will make it all the way to the controller into OVS, where it gets dropped. 
Should administrators take care of DSCP and COS tagging as part of best practices? Sure. But there are companies which don't. I personally ran into a similar issue in the company I worked for before, and this was not easy to troubleshoot. We ended up marking DSCP at the edge of the corporate network. We should of course have done this before, but we didn't, causing weird issues with some products that ran in the corporate network.

THe customer's concern is that their end customers may run into exactly the same scenarios, open a support ticket with the customer, thus creating a whole lot of overhead with the customer's support.

Hence, I see the following possibilities:
* we tell the customer to document with the end customers that they need to drop COS and thus send untagged traffic for flat networks only
* we change the neutron spec
* the customer can change the configuration of neutron to use VLAN provider networks with VLAN tag 0. I did not try this, but I suppose that this would work?

Thanks,

Andreas"}, {'account_id': 24042, 'date': '2018-10-31 17:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

neutron net-create provider10 --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network datacentre --provider:segmentation_id 0 --shared --router:external
neutron router-create router10
neutron router-gateway-set router10 provider10



Seems to be possible and would IMO do the job:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-int

 cookie=0xadec411fa0515253, duration=1188350.130s, table=0, n_packets=80, n_bytes=4196, priority=2,in_port="int-br-ex" actions=drop
 cookie=0xadec411fa0515253, duration=1188350.231s, table=0, n_packets=18538, n_bytes=2182045, priority=0 actions=NORMAL
 cookie=0xadec411fa0515253, duration=1188350.234s, table=23, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop
 cookie=0xadec411fa0515253, duration=1188350.230s, table=24, n_packets=0, n_bytes=0, priority=0 actions=drop'}, {'account_id': 24042, 'date': '2018-10-31 18:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

By the way, I don't know if:

neutron net-create provider10 --provider:network_type vlan --provider:physical_network datacentre --provider:segmentation_id 0 --shared --router:external
neutron router-create router10
neutron router-gateway-set router10 provider10

Would work with native VLANs without dot1q tags, it might not. So the current solution which is valid with the neutron contract defined in 
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/a388701ddfe628e9a5bd16a78422164799b11ef8/doc/source/admin/archives/adv-features.rst#terminology
~~~
flat network 	A virtual network implemented as packets on a specific physical network containing no IEEE 802.1Q header. Each physical network can realize at most one flat network.
~~~
is to strip dot1q tags for the native VLAN.

Kind regards,

Andreas'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-11-07 11:27:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

as per Sean's comments it shouldn't be done this way"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 08:29:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't filter on the DCI bit for flat networks

For flat networks, openvswitch-agent configure in br-int
an openflow rule to match packets without vlan id and to set
local vlan_id for such packets.
This was done by

    vlan_tci=0x0000/0x1fff

in rule match and this
works fine for frames without a dot1q tag.
According to openvswitch manual [1], we should set vlan_tci with
mask that will wildcard DCI bit to allow match also for dot1q
tagged frames on VLAN 0, e.g. it COP is modified, and VLAN ID is 0.

To fix that, this patch changes openflow rule created for such
networks in br-int to use:

    vlan_tci = 0x0000/0x0fff

which means that DCI bit is wildcarde in rule match.

[1] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs-2.5/ovs-ofctl.8.txt

Change-Id: Ia22ea54e16cfb4ae423836a06816ec43d9135df6
Closes-Bug: #1799599

commit_message:
Don't filter on the TCI bit for flat networks

For flat networks, openvswitch-agent configure in br-int
an openflow rule to match packets without vlan id and to set
local vlan_id for such packets.
This was done by

    vlan_tci=0x0000/0x1fff

in rule match and this
works fine for frames without a dot1q tag.
According to openvswitch manual [1], we should set vlan_tci with
mask that will wildcard TCI bit to allow match also for dot1q
tagged frames on VLAN 0, e.g. it COP is modified, and VLAN ID is 0.

To fix that, this patch changes openflow rule created for such
networks in br-int to use:

    vlan_tci = 0x0000/0x0fff

which means that DCI bit is wildcarde in rule match.

[1] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs-2.5/ovs-ofctl.8.txt

Change-Id: Ia22ea54e16cfb4ae423836a06816ec43d9135df6
Closes-Bug: #1799599

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:25:45.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I7a3555dd0f0c4bcd1969ca7d3669369d7517a6be
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-11-05 13:21:23.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I7a3555dd0f0c4bcd1969ca7d3669369d7517a6be
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615557

commit_message:
Add missing user defined interface support

Macvlan interfaces can have a user defined interface within the host
config. This change ensures that the capability, which is documented in
the nspawn_host role, is actually functional.

Change-Id: I083042a791d9213b9b1872a239dc18dc6c7ae46e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 17:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Combined backport from master to ensure nspawn functionality in rocky

The following commits have been cherry-picked and squashed.

    We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
    set the basepython value in each environment.

    We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
    want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

    We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
    breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
    py35 and py36.

    Add test for host_only networks and ensure network ordering

    The `host_only` network option did not have a functional test, this
    change adds one so that the mv-extra interface will now run with this
    which will ensure its functional when enabled. The "nspawn_combined_networks"
    also had an issue where the first network in the container config could
    be something other than the nspawn container network. This would shift
    the gateway from the mv-nspawn and to whatever was defined first. A
    change to the "nspawn_combined_networks" will now ensure
    "nspawn_networks" is referenced first.

Change-Id: I8f3b8c88a3611b5b29a6c497d1c1e55d39396e83

commit_message:
Combined backport from master to ensure nspawn functionality in rocky

The following commits have been cherry-picked and squashed.

    Add test for host_only networks and ensure network ordering

    The `host_only` network option did not have a functional test, this
    change adds one so that the mv-extra interface will now run with this
    which will ensure its functional when enabled. The "nspawn_combined_networks"
    also had an issue where the first network in the container config could
    be something other than the nspawn container network. This would shift
    the gateway from the mv-nspawn and to whatever was defined first. A
    change to the "nspawn_combined_networks" will now ensure
    "nspawn_networks" is referenced first.

Change-Id: I8f3b8c88a3611b5b29a6c497d1c1e55d39396e83

commit_message:
Add test for host_only networks and ensure network ordering

The `host_only` network option did not have a functional test, this
change adds one so that the mv-extra interface will now run with this
which will ensure its functional when enabled. The "nspawn_combined_networks"
also had an issue where the first network in the container config could
be something other than the nspawn container network. This would shift
the gateway from the mv-nspawn and to whatever was defined first. A
change to the "nspawn_combined_networks" will now ensure
"nspawn_networks" is referenced first.

Depends-On: Ic280db301ce44b98ac35c8911999dec5fa263a29
Change-Id: Id20afab8b705f6528ba5575ee4704c1661e6e65c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
