revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 15:18:38.000000000', 'message': 'Combined backport from master to ensure nspawn functionality in rocky

The following commits have been cherry-picked and squashed.

    Add route when required on the local table

    With the use of nspawn containers and macvlans, without an intermediary
    bridge, there's no way to send traffic from the host back to the
    container without configuring VEPA and having 802.1qg enabled
    switches. To enhance the usability of nspawn a local route is added to
    macvlan devices when an interface address is detected. This allows
    the host to route back to the containers without issues and will not
    interfere with the main host route. To ensure there's absolutely no
    conflict with host routes a metric has added to all routes added to the
    local table.

    Fix image preparation for bionic

    Ensure that the devices required for apt are present. Ensure
    that the required directories for gpg-agent are present. Ensure
    that the gpg-agent is running.

    Tuneup prep and local routing when running w/out bridges

    When running without bridges the local routing needs to be scoped to the
    host. This change ensures that is the care.

    When re-preping an environment the GPG setup will require aceess to fd's
    which may not exist at the time the base cache is re-prep'd.

    nspawn mtu settings will now follow the primary interface.

    Update reno for stable/rocky

    Document primary interfaces and add mv addresses

    The macvlan primary interface will now allow deployers to run a fully
    minimal network stack without any bridges or out-of-band configurations.
    This capability has now been added to the defaults with documentation
    regarding how its implemented.

    Use the TESTING_BRANCH env var for constraints

    The TESTING_BRANCH environment variable is provided by the
    run_tests.sh script and is derived from the .gitreview file.

    This ensures that once the master branch becomes a stable
    branch, the constraints from the stable branch in the
    integrated repository will automatically get used once the
    .gitreview file is updated.

    To ensure that the required environment variables are present
    we export them appropriately in run_tests.sh and modify the
    tox configuration to pass them into the tox test.

    Ensure libpython is included in base container builds

    the python libs are required to start uwsgi services and because the
    container images are so minimal the basic libs need to be installed.

    Ensure development libs are installed in containers

    These development libs are required by some services to build and
    start. This change adds the dev libs to the base image, which mirrors
    the base lxc image .

    Document adding "extra" networks

    This change moves the hidden `container_extra_networks` options to the
    defaults file and adds a blerb regarding how this functions.

    Add documentation for routed interfaces

    Using the container_(extra)_networks hash a user can define a routed
    interface for a network without an address. This change documents that
    capability.

    Allow user-defined extra distro packages

    This change allows the deployer to specify lists of distro packages
    which will be installed in addition to those specified by this role

    switch documentation job to new PTI

    This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
    jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
    python3-first goal.

    See the python3-first goal document for details:
    https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

    Simplify inserting apt keys into nspawn image

    Bionic requires a functioning gpg-agent to run apt-key add. This means
    that gpg-agent must be working properly in the chroot when the nspawn
    image preparation script runs.

    Previous changes [1] have enabled apt-key to communicate with gpg-agent
    during the nspawn_hosts role checks, however the cache prep fails almost
    every time when nspawn_hosts is used within other role checks.

    This is not a new issue, debian-installer is affected too [2].

    This change adopts the same route as d-i, and simply copies the host
    /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d directory to the nspawn image, removing the
    need for apt-key and in turn gpg-agent.

    This is a re-implementation of https://review.openstack.org/588962
    for nspawn.

    [1] https://review.openstack.org/590431
    [2] https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851774

    Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

    Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input
    method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

    Add missing variable for nspawn networking

    The variable `interface` is not defined in the `if` part of the
    conditional, however, it is referenced later on.

    fix tox python3 overrides

    We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
    set the basepython value in each environment.

    We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
    want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

    We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
    breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
    py35 and py36.

    fix tox python3 overrides

    We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
    set the basepython value in each environment.

    We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
    want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

    We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
    breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
    py35 and py36.

    Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

    Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

    Add host only network option

    The host only network function was adding a global network address and a
    host only network address which would flip flop should networkd or the
    nspawn-macvlan service be restarted. This change makes resolves the flip
    flopping and adds an option to enable this functionality when required.

    Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

    Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive

    The network rules used to be too broad and could result in conflict when
    address space is more restricted. This change updates the network rule
    set such that it will not only add address to a macvlan interface using
    the `noprefixroute` option and setting the route to the local table
    only. This limits the macvlan network scope to ensure we're not creating
    conflicts while also not breaking inter host connectivity.

    Install the timezone package by default

    The timezone package is required in order to have the containers report
    correct time the timezone package is required. This change install the
    tz package across all of the distros we support.

    Correct host only routes

    The host only route was adding the cidr twice which is wrong. This
    change adds the missing network filter to correct the issue.

Change-Id: Ie0e8961fb8b6718efab88695428068b001b6b0a1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

    method. When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

    Add missing variable for nspawn networking

    The variable `interface` is not defined in the `if` part of the
    conditional, however, it is referenced later on.

    Add host only network option

    The host only network function was adding a global network address and a
    host only network address which would flip flop should networkd or the
    nspawn-macvlan service be restarted. This change makes resolves the flip
    flopping and adds an option to enable this functionality when required.

    Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive

    The network rules used to be too broad and could result in conflict when
    address space is more restricted. This change updates the network rule
    set such that it will not only add address to a macvlan interface using
    the `noprefixroute` option and setting the route to the local table
    only. This limits the macvlan network scope to ensure we're not creating
    conflicts while also not breaking inter host connectivity.

    Install the timezone package by default

    The timezone package is required in order to have the containers report
    correct time the timezone package is required. This change install the
    tz package across all of the distros we support.

    Correct host only routes

    The host only route was adding the cidr twice which is wrong. This
    change adds the missing network filter to correct the issue.

Change-Id: Ie0e8961fb8b6718efab88695428068b001b6b0a1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Combined backport from master to ensure nspawn functionality in rocky

The following commits have been cherry-picked and squashed.

https://review.openstack.org/588406
Add route when required on the local table

https://review.openstack.org/593275
Ensure libpython is included in base container builds

https://review.openstack.org/593359
Ensure development libs are installed in containers

https://review.openstack.org/593967
Document adding "extra" networks

https://review.openstack.org/593974
Add documentation for routed interfaces

https://review.openstack.org/594142
Allow user-defined extra distro packages

https://review.openstack.org/602476
Add missing variable for nspawn networking

https://review.openstack.org/606775
Add host only network option

https://review.openstack.org/607804
Modify the network to ensure their more restrictive

https://review.openstack.org/607805
Install the timezone package by default

https://review.openstack.org/608735
Correct host only routes

Change-Id: Ie0e8961fb8b6718efab88695428068b001b6b0a1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I3abe6a3cbbe6985b61797db70472e4218f66d0ba

commit_message:
auth url should never should be None

urlparse method of urllib in python2 throws exception
if it tries to parse 'None' in python3 it behaves correctly
no exception is thrown

this fixes the py27 tox failure

Depends-on: Iac42f592834734a6fddb743e947860b3bb7e1aba
Change-Id: I5c2399eb2bc8874dc03f96970af9f56539060502

commit_message:
Add documentation for routed interfaces

Using the container_(extra)_networks hash a user can define a routed
interface for a network without an address. This change documents that
capability.

Change-Id: I93bdfde1aa5a9820d1853a779caf6670ee58d335
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Install the timezone package by default

The timezone package is required in order to have the containers report
correct time the timezone package is required. This change install the
tz package across all of the distros we support.

Change-Id: I2aa2561cc6e2c71db0a16590f5d9dbab24b393d2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-07 10:22:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update messaging configuration

This patch removes  the conditional inclusion of messaging sections

The patch conidtionally selects the notifier driver.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-06 17:30:06.000000000', 'message': 'Rename uwsgi-plugin-python to uwsgi-plugin-python2 in CentOS

On Queens and earlier builds, source CentOS images fail with this error:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:No package uwsgi-plugin-python available.
INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:1mError: Not tolerating missing names on install, stopping.
INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:m

CentOS binary builds fail with a similar error in the barbican-api
image.

This seems to have been caused by a rename of uwsgi-plugin-python to
uwsgi-plugin-python2 [1].

That bug report claims that a virtual provides will be added to the
package to make the change backwards compatible, but this does not seem
to have been done yet.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1628147

Change-Id: If9b43dbf3fab6a76f47a0e4fb9213c5efa655c0d

commit_message:
Rename uwsgi-plugin-python to uwsgi-plugin-python2 in CentOS

On Queens and earlier builds, source CentOS images fail with this error:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:No package uwsgi-plugin-python available.
INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:1mError: Not tolerating missing names on install, stopping.
INFO:kolla.common.utils.barbican-base:m

CentOS binary builds fail with a similar error in the barbican-api
image.

This seems to have been caused by a rename of uwsgi-plugin-python to
uwsgi-plugin-python2 [1].

That bug report claims that a virtual provides will be added to the
package to make the change backwards compatible, but this does not seem
to have been done yet.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1628147

Also this PS cherry-picks 2316743d1e5b85ade1f4beac3ac58c9f3081ab8f
Without both changes, gates are broken and cannot merge non of them.

Change-Id: If9b43dbf3fab6a76f47a0e4fb9213c5efa655c0d
Closes-Bug: #1794039
(cherry picked from commit d45e2295d9eebab68eb635875d479379636cbef3)

commit_message:
Refactor CI testing scripts

This change is intended to ease the addition of new test scenarios, by
splitting the existing setup_gate.sh script up into several smaller
scripts. We may wish to further break these scripts up in future,
depending on the requirements of new test jobs.

Change-Id: Ifa442ac79a54f749c56d20f5f7383c3852d95268

commit_message:
Stop supporting revocation list

With keystone's move to eliminating pki, pkiz, and uuid tokens the
revocation list is no longer generated. Keystonemiddleware no longer
needs to attempt to retrieve it and reference it.

Change-Id: Ief3bf1941e62f9136dbed11877bca81c4102041b
closes-bug: #1361743
partial-bug: #1649735
partial-bug: #1736985

Can we please add a bit more background info in the commit message? 
(rationale, why we we are setting it, why 60 as default, etc.)'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-08-29 13:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

this definitely needs a launchpad issue as well.   I "know" the reason this connect_timeout is being changed, but I don't like the conditions that lead to it - it means your services are running poorly and need to be tuned.   Also, this patch doesn't exactly "conflict" with, but is sort of attempting to solve the same problem as this undercloud patch, but in a different way: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586282/   .  there was some debate over if we should be providing a generic "catchall" dictionary into the mysql settings so that operators can just do whatever.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-09-12 16:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-11-07 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: Adding driver to mysql connection URL
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 09:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Adding driver to mysql connection URL

With current URL [1], default driver will be used.
In order to ensure the compatibility, it is better to include the exact driver [2].

[1] connection = mysql://
[2] connection = mysql+pymysql://

Change-Id: Ifa66bb4a5d876a91c35cec80f19c49b459ebc129
'}]
commit_message:
Adding driver to mysql connection URL

With current URL [1], default driver will be used.
In order to ensure the compatibility, it is better to include the exact driver [2].

[1] connection = mysql://
[2] connection = mysql+pymysql://

Change-Id: Ifa66bb4a5d876a91c35cec80f19c49b459ebc129

commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary rewrites of ceph.conf

Charm should avoid writing ceph.conf unless it absolutely needs
to since this can clash with other processes that might be
reading the file (such as ceph-disk called by udev).

Change-Id: I3790b5b16fa1473f1c3271b795b3d32c5e8d2fad
Closes-Bug: #1783113

commit_message:
Make Queens and Rocky share same conf template

The original patch for this bug fixed the problem for
rocky only but queens also suffers from the same
problem. Since the only diff between the P and R
templates is this change, move it into Q so that
Q and R will both get the fix.

Change-Id: Ib4573aa925cb1b3b9e1fa04e8a3c5bf611223c25
Related-Bug: #1788631
(cherry picked from commit 31a7dd32d76394210e53ca36d3fc1fbd210ee368)

Add py36 tox environment

We already run python3.6 unit tests in CI. Add the py36 environment to
the tox file so that developers with python3.6 available locally can opt
into running that version too.

[{'created': '2018-11-02 08:29:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fail if --install-deps have missing RPMs with yum

Looks like yum does not fail if you try to install multiple RPMs and one
of the is missing, is not the case for dnf, we add a directive to
enforce that and check the result code also.

Change-Id: Ic112066d3757fe64c857f39b0c126fd0b6e01945
'}, {'created': '2018-11-02 08:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fail if --install-deps have missing RPMs with yum

Looks like yum does not fail if you try to install multiple RPMs and one
of the is missing, is not the case for dnf, we add a directive to
enforce that and check the result code also.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/153?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: Ic112066d3757fe64c857f39b0c126fd0b6e01945
'}]
commit_message:
Fail if --install-deps have missing RPMs with yum

Looks like yum does not fail if you try to install multiple RPMs and one
of the is missing, is not the case for dnf, we add a directive to
enforce that and check the result code also.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/153?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: Ic112066d3757fe64c857f39b0c126fd0b6e01945

commit_message:
Fix usage of cachetools in lookup_utils

* In the latest version of cachetools lib (3.0.0) the previously
  deprecated argument "missing" of cache classes has been removed.
* Disabled test_generator failing due to the changes in the
  senlin client until it's fixed by https://review.openstack.org/614211

Change-Id: Iac42f592834734a6fddb743e947860b3bb7e1aba

commit_message:
WIP - openstackdocstheme/theme/starlingx: Menu/URL updates for StarlingX theme

I applied actual URLs for StarlingX manuals that exist.  Purged remaining
OpenStack stuff out of the header, footer, license, normal sidebare,
and API sidebar.

Updated the tox.ini file to have Sphinx commands to use the StarlingX
theme instead of the OpenStack theme.  I did this for the
releasenotes and api-ref sections.

Change-Id: I15faceb7b5cbc4276ee6cec89d46e3403e845d91
Signed-off-by: Scott Rifenbark <srifenbark@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make sure only one port_id is given.

It could happen by mistake that both port_id and port parameters are
passed to create_floating_ip method. In such case verify they are
the same port to avoid undetected problems.

Change-Id: I4ebdbca21a2f8285cf22f57f55e52892c9feb34d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-07 01:22:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test error of freezer client

Freezer team has updated freezerclient, they remove
the version parameter in Client. This make karbor
not work well when using freezer protection plugin,
this patch will fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1802022

Change-Id: Iea594ff2917767108b868242d919db97a65479ea
'}, {'created': '2018-11-07 01:24:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix initialization error of freezer client

Freezer team has updated freezerclient, they remove
the version parameter in Client. This make karbor
not work well when using freezer protection plugin,
this patch will fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1802022

Change-Id: Iea594ff2917767108b868242d919db97a65479ea
'}, {'created': '2018-11-07 07:17:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test error of nova freezer client updates

This patch mainly contains two aspects:

1. Freezer team has updated freezerclient, they remove
the version parameter in Client. This make karbor
not work well when using freezer protection plugin.

2. Nova client remove self.logger as default from nova
client, it requires karbor transport logger to the
client.

Closes-Bug: #1802022

Change-Id: Iea594ff2917767108b868242d919db97a65479ea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test error of nova freezer client updates

This patch mainly contains two aspects:

1. Freezer team has updated freezerclient, they remove
the version parameter in Client. This make karbor
not work well when using freezer protection plugin.

2. Nova client remove self.logger as default from nova
client, it requires karbor transport logger to the
client.

Closes-Bug: #1802022

Change-Id: Iea594ff2917767108b868242d919db97a65479ea

commit_message:
add paste deployment config into Watcher

Haproxy checks health with Watcher-api by acess Root.
But it required authentication, and returned failure.

It requires no authentication when acess Root, by using
authtoken factory.

Change-Id: I0a54909769eecb302c51aeb01388dc6ca6c2aadf
Closes-Bug: #1726725

Add dhcp_profile and metadata_proxy config params in neutron nsx
plugin to reflect latest nsx plugin change, and also introduce

commit_message:
Adds new neutron nsx plugin parameters

Add dhcp_profile and metadata_proxy config params in neutron nsx
plugin to reflect latest nsx plugin change, and also introduce
a few new config params. The old dhcp_profile_uuid and
metadata_proxy_uuid params are deprecated.

Change-Id: Ibd6d97948dd5416fe66087646acf81821c962cb6
(cherry picked from commit 1bb66239e9b2697412fd74d4b036081b459f3541)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Fix urllib references

The transition form urllib2 to urllib was not quite right. Some changes were
missing .request and .error from the references.

Change-Id: Icdc0eb7456b5385a0ef3aa67018f7c64985ed7c7
Story: 2000975
Task: 27818
